translated: so too the horse treasure; the jewel treasure, which is able to dispel darkness in a region a yojana in extent, even in the absence of the four kinds of illumination ;

original: andhakāraṃ vidhamitvā ālokadassanasamatthassa maṇiratanassa, chabbidhaṃ dosaṃ vivajjetvā
analyzed: andhakāram vidhamitvā āloka dassana samatthassa maṇi ratanassa chabbidham dosam vivajjetvā
translated: the woman treasure, which is pleasing in conduct, free from the six faults of women;

original: manāpacārino itthiratanassa, yojanappamāṇe padese antopathavigatānaṃ nidhīnaṃ dassanasamatthassa
analyzed: manāpa cārino itthi ratanassa yojana ppamāṇe padese antopathavigatānam nidhīnam dassana samatthassa
translated: the house-holder treasure, which is able to show the king the buried treasures in the earth, even those that are a yojana away, and to say, “Here is a treasure, your majesty”;

original: gahapatiratanassa, aggamahesiyā kucchimhi nibbattitvā sakalarajjānusāsanasamatthassa
analyzed: gahapati ratanassa aggamahesiyā kucchimhi nibbattitvā sakala rajja anusāsana samatthassa
translated: and the Jewel of the Counsellor, who is the eldest son, is born with the ability to advise on the whole kingdom.

original: jeṭṭhaputtasaṅkhātassa pariṇāyakaratanassa ca pātubhāvo hotīti. Ayamettha saṅkhepo.
analyzed: jeṭṭha putta saṅkhātassa pariṇāyaka ratanassa ca pātubhāvaḥ hoti iti ayam ettha saṅkhepo
translated: This is the brief account here.

original: Vitthārato pana tesaṃ cakkaratanādīnaṃ pātubhāvavidhānaṃ mahāsudassanādīsu suttesu
analyzed: vitthārato pana tesam cakka ratana ādīnam pātubhāva vidhānam mahāsudassana ādīsu suttesu
translated: But the detailed account of the way in which the Wheel-Jewel and the rest appear is given in the Mahāsudassana Sutta, etc.,

original: āgatameva. Atthopissa tesaṃ vaṇṇanāya saṃvaṇṇitoyeva.🔽Satisambojjhaṅgaratanassātiādīsu sarikkhakatā evaṃ veditabbā – yatheva hi cakkavattino🔽cakkaratanaṃ sabbaratanānaṃ purecaraṃ, evaṃ satisambojjhaṅgaratanaṃ sabbesaṃ catubhūmakadhammānaṃ
analyzed: āgatam eva atthaḥ pi ssa tesam vaṇṇanāya saṃvaṇṇitaḥ yeva  sati sambojjhaṅga ratanassa ati ādīsu sarikkhaka tā evam veditabbā yathā iva hi cakkavattinaḥ  cakka ratanam sabba ratanānam purecaram evam sati sambojjhaṅga ratanam sabbesam catu bhūmaka dhammānam
translated: and their meaning has been commented on in the commentary.🔽As to the Jewel of the Mindfulness Factor of Complete Awakening, etc., the similarity should be understood in this way. Just as the Wheel-Turning Monarch’s Wheel-Jewel goes in front of all his treasures,

original: purecaranti, purecaraṇaṭṭhena cakkavattirañño cakkaratanasadisaṃ hoti. Cakkavattino
analyzed: purecaranti purecaraṇa ṭṭhena cakkavatti raññaḥ cakka ratana sadisam hoti cakkavattino
translated: so this Jewel of the Mindfulness Factor of Complete Awakening goes in front of all the dhammas of the three planes. It is like the Wheel-Turning Monarch’s Wheel-Jewel in the sense of going in front.

original: ca ratanesu mahākāyūpapannaṃ accuggataṃ vipulaṃ mahantaṃ hatthiratanaṃ, idampi dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgaratanaṃ
analyzed: ca ratanesu mahā kāyu upapannam accuggatam vipulam mahantam hatthi ratanam idam api dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅga ratanam
translated: And just as the Wheel-Turning Monarch’s Elephant-Jewel is of great size, of lofty stature, of vast extent, and of great height,🔽so this Jewel of the Investigation-of-States Factor of Complete Awakening

original: mahantaṃ dhammakāyūpapannaṃ accuggataṃ vipulaṃ mahantanti hatthiratanasadisaṃ hoti.🔽Cakkavattino assaratanaṃ sīghaṃ lahu javaṃ, idampi vīriyasambojjhaṅgaratanaṃ sīghaṃ
analyzed: mahantam dhammakāya upapannam accuggatam vipulam mahantam ti hatthi ratana sadisam hoti  cakkavattinaḥ assa ratanam sīgham lahu javam idam pi vīriya sambojjhaṅga ratanam sīgham
translated: and it is great, having arisen as a great mass of Dhamma, and it is lofty, wide, and great, so it is like the elephant treasure.🔽The Wheel-Treasure of the King who turns the Wheel is swift, fast, and speedy, and this enlightenment factor of energy is swift, fast, and speedy,

original: lahu javanti imāya sīghalahujavatāya assaratanasadisaṃ hoti. Cakkavattino maṇiratanaṃ
analyzed: lahu javanti imāya sīgha lahu java tāya assa ratana sadisam hoti cakkavattinaḥ maṇi ratanam
translated: so it is like the horse treasure in being swift, fast, and speedy. The Gem Treasure of the Wheel-turning Monarch

original: andhakāraṃ vidhamati, ālokaṃ dasseti, idampi pītisambojjhaṅgaratanaṃ tāya ekantakusalattā
analyzed: andhakāram vidhamati ālokam dasseti idam pi pīti sambojjhaṅga ratanam tāya ekanta kusala ttā
translated: dispels darkness and shows visible objects, and this enlightenment factor of rapture does the same by its being exclusively profitable,

original: kilesandhakāraṃ vidhamati, sahajātapaccayādivasena ñāṇālokaṃ dassetīti iminā andhakāravidhamanaālokadassanabhāvena🔽maṇiratanasadisaṃ hoti.
analyzed: kilesa andhakāram vidhamati sahajāta paccaya ādi vasena ñāṇa ālokam dasseti iti iminā andhakāra vidhamana āloka dassana bhāvena  maṇi ratana sadisam hoti
translated: for it dispels the darkness of defilements and shows the light of knowledge by being a condition for the associated states. So it is like the gem treasure in dispelling darkness and showing visible objects.

original: Cakkavattino itthiratanaṃ kāyacittadarathaṃ paṭipassambheti, pariḷāhaṃ vūpasameti.
analyzed: cakkavattinaḥ itthi ratanam paṭipassambheti pariḷāham vūpasameti
translated: The Woman Treasure of the Wheel-turning Monarch allays his bodily fatigue and allays his mental fatigue, and it allays his fever of the mind and the desire of the mind.

original: Idampi passaddhisambojjhaṅgaratanaṃ kāyacittadarathaṃ paṭipassambheti, pariḷāhaṃ
analyzed: idam api passaddhi sambojjhaṅga ratanam paṭipassambheti pariḷāham
translated: This enlightenment factor of tranquillity allays bodily fatigue and allays mental fatigue,🔽and it allays fever of the mind and desire of the mind.

original: vūpasametīti itthiratanasadisaṃ hoti. Cakkavattino gahapatiratanaṃ icchiticchitakkhaṇe
analyzed: vūpasameti iti itthi ratana sadisam hoti cakkavattinaḥ gahapati ratanam icchiticchita kkhaṇe
translated: and it is like the Jewel of a woman.

original: dhanadānena vikkhepaṃ pacchinditvā cittaṃ ekaggaṃ karoti, idampi samādhisambojjhaṅgaratanaṃ
analyzed: dhana dānena vikkhepam pacchinditvā cittam ekaggam karoti idam api samādhi sambojjhaṅga ratanam
translated: The Jewel of a Householder of a Universal Monarch cuts off distraction and makes the mind one-pointed by giving wealth as desired at the desired moment.🔽This Jewel of the Concentration Factor of Complete Awakening

original: yathicchitādivasena appanaṃ sampādeti, vikkhepaṃ pacchinditvā cittaṃ ekaggaṃ karotīti
analyzed: yathicchita ādi vasena appanam sampādeti vikkhepam pacchinditvā cittam ekaggam karoti iti
translated: accomplishes absorption according to desire, etc., and it cuts off distraction and makes the mind one-pointed.🔽It is like the Jewel of a Householder.

original: gahapatiratanasadisaṃ hoti. Cakkavattino ca pariṇāyakaratanaṃ sabbatthakiccasampādanena🔽appossukkataṃ karoti. Idampi upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaratanaṃ cittuppādaṃ līnuddhaccato
analyzed: gahapati ratana sadisam hoti cakkavattino ca pariṇāyaka ratanam sabbattha kicca sampādanena  appossukkatam karoti idam pi upekkhā sambojjhaṅga ratanam cittuppādam līn uddhaccato
translated: And the Jewel of a Counsellor of a Universal Monarch makes him effortless by accomplishing all tasks everywhere.🔽This Jewel of the Equanimity Factor of Complete Awakening makes him effortless by placing the application in the middle, after freeing the arising of consciousness from depression and agitation.

original: mocetvā payogamajjhatte ṭhapayamānaṃ appossukkataṃ karotīti pariṇāyakaratanasadisaṃ
analyzed: mocetvā payogam ajjhatte ṭhapayamānam appossukkatam karoti iti pariṇāyaka ratana sadisam
translated: It is like the Jewel of a Counsellor.

original: hoti. Iti imasmiṃ sutte catubhūmako sabbasaṅgāhikadhammaparicchedo kathitoti veditabbo.
analyzed: hoti iti imasmim sutte catu bhūmakaḥ sabba saṅgāhika dhamma paricchedaḥ kathitaḥ iti veditabbaḥ
translated: Thus, it should be understood that in this sutta, the section on the Dhamma that includes everything in four stages is explained.

original: 4-10. Duppaññasuttādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: duppañña sutta ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: -. Explanation of the Duppañña Sutta, etc.

original: 225-231. Catutthe eḷamūgoti mukhena vācaṃ nicchāretuṃ sakkontopi dosehi mūgo asampannavacano. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānatthamevāti.🔽Cakkavattivaggo.🔽6. Sākacchavaggo
analyzed: catutthe eḷamūgo ti mukhena vācam nicchāretum sakkontaḥ api dosehi mūgaḥ asampanna vacano sesam sabbattha uttāna attham eva ati  cakkavatti vaggaḥ  sākacchavaggaḥ
translated: In the fourth, “dumb” means one who is unable to utter speech with his mouth, who is defective in speech. The rest is clear in all instances.🔽The Chapter of Wheel-turning Monarchs🔽The Chapter on Discussion

original: 1. Āhārasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: āhāra sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sutta on Food

original: 232. Chaṭṭhavaggassa paṭhame ayamāhāro anuppannassa vā satisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāyātiādīsu
analyzed: chaṭṭha vaggassa paṭhame ayam āhāraḥ anuppannassa vā sati sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya ati ādīsu
translated: In the first of the sixth chapter, “This is the nutriment for the arising of the unarisen enlightenment factor of mindfulness” and so on.

original: ayaṃ purimanayato viseso. Na kevalañhi satisambojjhaṅgādīnaṃ ete vuttappakārāva uppādāya,
analyzed: ayam purima nayataḥ visesaḥ na kevalam hi sati sambojjhaṅga ādīnam ete vutta ppakārā uppādāya
translated: This is the difference here from the previous method. For not only are these the conditions for the arising of the enlightenment factor of mindfulness, etc.,

original: uppannānaṃ vā bhāvanāya pāripūriyā paccayā honti, aññepi pana evaṃ veditabbā. Aparepi🔽hi cattāro dhammā satisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti satisampajaññaṃ muṭṭhassatipuggalaparivajjanatā
analyzed: uppannānam vā bhāvanāya pāripūriyā paccayāḥ honti aññe pi pana evam veditabbāḥ apare pi  hi cattāro dhammā sati sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti sati sampajaññam muṭṭha ssati puggala parivajjana tā
translated: but also for the fulfilment of their development when they have arisen. But others too should be understood in this way.🔽For four things lead to the arising of the enlightenment factor of mindfulness: mindfulness, clear comprehension, avoidance of persons lacking in mindfulness,

original: upaṭṭhitassatipuggalasevanatā tadadhimuttatāti. Abhikkantādīsu hi sattasu ṭhānesu
analyzed: upaṭṭhita ssati puggala sevana tā tad adhimutta tā ati abhikkanta ādīsu hi sattasu ṭhānesu
translated: and cultivation of persons who are full of mindfulness. And the four things that lead to the arising of the enlightenment factor of discrimination of states are:

original: satisampajaññena, bhattanikkhittakākasadise muṭṭhassatipuggale parivajjanena, tissadattattheraabhayattherādisadise
analyzed: sati sampajaññena bhatta nikkhitta kāka sadise muṭṭha ssati puggale parivajjanena tissadatta tthera abhaya tthera ādi sadise
translated: By avoiding people who are forgetful and negligent as if they were a poisoned meal,🔽and by cultivating people who are mindful and vigilant like the Elder Tissa, the Elder Abhaya, and others,

original: upaṭṭhitassatipuggale sevanena, ṭhānanisajjādīsu satisamuṭṭhāpanatthaṃ ninnapoṇapabbhāracittatāya🔽ca satisambojjhaṅgo uppajjati. Evaṃ catūhi kāraṇehi uppannassa panassa arahattamaggena
analyzed: upaṭṭhita ssati puggale sevanena ṭhāna nisajja ādīsu sati samuṭṭhāpana attham ninna poṇa pabbhāra citta tāya  ca sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ uppajjati evam catūhi kāraṇehi uppannassa panassa arahatta maggena
translated: and by having a mind that is inclined, bent, and directed to the arousing of mindfulness in all postures,

original: bhāvanāpāripūrī hoti.
analyzed: bhāvanā pāripūrī hoti
translated: the enlightenment factor of mindfulness arises. When it has arisen in this way, its fulfilment is through the path of arahantship.🔽Seven things lead to the arising of the enlightenment factor of discrimination of states: asking questions,

original: Satta dhammā dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti – paripucchakatā vatthuvisadakiriyā
analyzed: satta dhammā dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti paripucchaka tā vatthu visada kiriyā
translated: making the basis clean,🔽balancing the faculties,🔽avoiding persons without conviction,🔽cultivating persons with conviction,

original: indriyasamattapaṭipādanā duppaññapuggalaparivajjanā paññavantapuggalasevanā gambhīrañāṇacariyapaccavekkhaṇā🔽tadadhimuttatāti. Tattha paripucchakatāti khandhadhātuāyatanaindriyabalabojjhaṅgamaggaṅgajhānaṅgasamathavipassanānaṃ
analyzed: indriya samatta paṭipādanā duppañña puggala parivajjanā paññavanta puggala sevanā gambhīra ñāṇa cariya paccavekkhaṇā  tad adhimutta tā ti tattha paripucchaka tā ti khandha dhātu āyatana aindriya bala bojjhaṅga maggaṅga jhānaṅga samatha vipassanānaṃ
translated: reviewing the range of knowledge,🔽and resoluteness upon that.

original: atthasannissitaparipucchābahulatā.
analyzed: attha sannissita paripucchā bahula tā
translated: Herein, asking questions is the asking of many questions about the meaning of the aggregates, sense bases, elements, faculties, truths, dependent origination, and the foundations of mindfulness, etc.,

original: Vatthuvisadakiriyāti ajjhattikabāhirānaṃ vatthūnaṃ visadabhāvakaraṇaṃ. Yadā hissa
analyzed: vatthu visada kiriyā ati ajjhattika bāhirānam vatthūnam visada bhāva karaṇam yadā
translated: Making the physical basis bright means making the internal and external physical bases bright.

original: kesanakhalomāni dīghāni honti, sarīraṃ vā ussannadosañceva sedamalamakkhitañca, tadā
analyzed: kesa nakha lomāni dīghāni honti sarīram vai ussanna dosam ca iva tadā
translated: For when his head hair, nails and body hair are long, or when his body is feverish and smeared with sweat, grease, and dirt,

original: ajjhattikavatthu avisadaṃ hoti aparisuddhaṃ. Yadā pana cīvaraṃ jiṇṇaṃ kiliṭṭhaṃ duggandhaṃ
analyzed: ajjhattika vatthu avisadam hoti aparisuddham yadā pana cīvaram jiṇṇam kiliṭṭham duggandham
translated: then the internal physical basis is not bright, is not purified. But when his robe is worn out, dirty, and smelly,

original: hoti, senāsanaṃ vā uklāpaṃ, tadā bāhiravatthu avisadaṃ hoti aparisuddhaṃ. Tasmā kesādichedanena
analyzed: hoti senāsanam vā uklāpam tadā bāhira vatthu avisadam hoti a parisuddham tasmā kesa ādi chedanena
translated: or when the lodging is dilapidated, then the external physical basis is not bright, is not purified. Therefore, by cutting the head hair and so on,

original: uddhaṃvirecanaadhovirecanādīhi sarīrasallahukabhāvakaraṇena ucchādananahāpanena ca
analyzed: sarīra sat lahuka bhāva karaṇena ucchādanana hāpanena ca
translated: and by making the body light through purgation, emetics, and so on, and by rubbing and bathing it,

original: ajjhattikavatthu visadaṃ kātabbaṃ. Sūcikammadhovanarajanaparibhaṇḍakaraṇādīhi bāhiravatthu
analyzed: ajjhattika vatthu visadam kātabbam sūci kamma dhovana rajana paribhaṇḍa karaṇa ādīhi bāhira vatthu
translated: the internal physical basis should be made bright. By sewing, washing, dying, and patching the robe, and by repairing the lodging,

original: visadaṃ kātabbaṃ. Etasmiñhi ajjhattikabāhire vatthumhi avisade uppannesu cittacetasikesu
analyzed: visadam kātabbam etasmin hi ajjhattika bāhire vatthumhi avisade uppannesu citta cetasikesu
translated: the external physical basis should be made bright. For when the internal and external physical bases are not bright,

original: ñāṇampi avisadaṃ aparisuddhaṃ hoti aparisuddhāni dīpakapallakavaṭṭitelāni nissāya
analyzed: ñāṇam pi a visadam a parisuddham hoti a parisuddhāni dīpaka pallaka vaṭṭi telāni nissāya
translated: the consciousness and consciousness-concomitants that arise are not bright, are not purified. They are like the light and heat of a lamp fed by an oil mixed with dirt,🔽or like the light and heat of a lamp fed by oil in a pot covered with a dirty cloth.

original: uppannadīpasikhāya obhāso viya. Visade pana ajjhattikabāhire vatthumhi uppannesu
analyzed: uppanna dīpa sikhāya obhāsaḥ viya visade pana ajjhattika bāhire vatthumhi uppannesu
translated: But when consciousnesses and consciousness-concomitants arise in a clear external or internal object,

original: cittacetasikesu ñāṇampi visadaṃ hoti parisuddhāni dīpakapallakavaṭṭitelāni nissāya🔽uppannadīpasikhāya obhāso viya. Tena vuttaṃ – “vatthuvisadakiriyā dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa
analyzed: citta cetasikesu ñāṇam pi visadam hoti parisuddhāni dīpaka pallaka vaṭṭi telāni nissāya  uppanna dīpa sikhāya obhāsaḥ viya tena vuttam vatthu visada kiriyā dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgassa
translated: the knowledge is clear too, like the light of a lamp when it is lit with a clear wick and oil.🔽That is why it was said above: “The clearing up of the object is the cause for the arising of the investigation-of-states enlightenment factor.”

original: uppādāya saṃvattatī”ti.
analyzed: uppādāya saṃvattati iti
translated: “The arousing of the equanimity of insight” is the arousing of the equanimity of the path.🔽For when the path is arisen, the equanimity of insight is aroused.🔽That is why it was said above: “The arousing of the equanimity of insight is the cause for the arising of the equanimity enlightenment factor.”

original: Indriyasamattapaṭipādanā nāma saddhādīnaṃ indriyānaṃ samabhāvakaraṇaṃ. Sace hissa
analyzed: indriya samatta paṭipādanā nāma saddhā ādīnam sama bhāva karaṇam sace hissa
translated: “The balancing of faculties” is the making of faculties that are not balanced into balanced ones.

original: saddhindriyaṃ balavaṃ hoti, itarāni mandāni, tato vīriyindriyaṃ paggahakiccaṃ, satindriyaṃ
analyzed: saddhi indriyam balavam hoti itarāni mandāni tatas vīriya indriyam paggaha kiccam sati indriyam
translated: For if the faith faculty is strong and the others are weak, then the energy faculty cannot perform its function of exerting,🔽the mindfulness faculty its function of establishing ,🔽the concentration faculty its function of not placing the mind externally,

original: upaṭṭhānakiccaṃ, samādhindriyaṃ avikkhepakiccaṃ, paññindriyaṃ dassanakiccaṃ kātuṃ
analyzed: upaṭṭhāna kiccam samādhi indriyam avikkhepa kiccam paññindriyam dassana kiccam kātuṃ
translated: and the understanding faculty its function of seeing.

original: na sakkoti. Tasmā taṃ dhammasabhāvapaccavekkhaṇena vā, yathā vā manasikaroto balavaṃ
analyzed: na sakkoti tasmai tam dhamma sabhāva paccavekkhaṇena vā yathā vā manasikarotaḥ balavam
translated: So that one should review the individual essences of the states or direct his mind to their common mark of impermanence, etc., in such a way that the faith faculty, etc., become balanced.

original: jātaṃ, tathā amanasikaraṇena hāpetabbaṃ. Vakkalittheravatthu cettha nidassanaṃ. Sace
analyzed: jātam tathā a manasikaraṇena hāpetabbam vakkalitthera vatthu ca ittha nidassanam sace
translated: and it should be eliminated by non-attention in the way already described. The story of the Elder Vakkali may be cited here as an example.

original: pana vīriyindriyaṃ balavaṃ hoti, atha neva saddhindriyaṃ adhimokkhakiccaṃ kātuṃ sakkoti,
analyzed: pana vīriya indriyam balavam hoti atha na iva saddhi indriyam adhimokkha kiccam kātum sakkoti
translated: But if the energy faculty is strong, then the faith faculty is unable to perform the function of resolving,

original: na itarāni itarakiccabhedaṃ. Tasmā taṃ passaddhādibhāvanāya hāpetabbaṃ. Tatthāpi🔽soṇattherassa vatthu dassetabbaṃ. Evaṃ sesesupi ekassa balavabhāve sati itaresaṃ
analyzed: na itarāni itara kicca bhedam tasmā tam passaddha ādi bhāvanāya tattha api  soṇa ttherassa vatthu dassetabbam evam sesesu pi ekassa balava bhāve sati itaresam
translated: and the other faculties are unable to perform their several functions. So it should be eliminated by the development of the tranquillity faculty, etc.,

original: attano kiccesu asamatthatā veditabbā.
analyzed: attano kiccesu asamattha tā veditabbā
translated: and the story of the Elder Soṇa should be cited here too. So too with the remaining faculties. When one is strong the others are unable to perform their several functions.

original: Visesato panettha saddhāpaññānaṃ samādhivīriyānañca samataṃ pasaṃsanti. Balavasaddho🔽hi mandapañño mudhappasanno hoti, avatthusmiṃ pasīdati. Balavapañño pana mandasaddho
analyzed: visesato pana ittha saddhā paññānam samādhi vīriyānam ca samatam pasaṃsanti balava saddho  hi manda paññaḥ mudhappasannaḥ hoti avatthusmim pasīdati balava paññaḥ pana manda saddho
translated: But in particular they praise the balance of faith and understanding, and of concentration and energy.🔽For one strong in faith but weak in understanding is lacking in resolution and is easily satisfied; he is credulous.

original: kerāṭikapakkhaṃ bhajati, bhesajjasamuṭṭhito viya rogo atekiccho hoti. Cittuppādamatteneva
analyzed: kerāṭika pakkham bhajati bhesajja samuṭṭhitaḥ viya rogaḥ atekicchaḥ hoti cittuppāda mattena iva
translated: But one strong in understanding but weak in faith is a sceptic and is difficult to convince; he is like a patient without medicine who consults a doctor.

original: kusalaṃ hotīti atidhāvitvā dānādīni akaronto niraye uppajjati. Ubhinnaṃ samatāya🔽vatthusmiṃyeva pasīdati. Balavasamādhiṃ pana mandavīriyaṃ samādhissa kosajjapakkhattā
analyzed: kusalam hoti iti atidhāvitvā dāna ādīni a karontaḥ niraye uppajjati ubhinnam samatāya  vatthusmiṃ yeva pasīdati balava samādhim pana manda vīriyam samādhissa kosajja pakkhattā
translated: He is reborn in hell if he overshoots the mark and does not do the giving, etc.,🔽and he is reborn in the Brahmā-world if he does them.🔽But if concentration is strong and energy weak, then since idleness is a near enemy of concentration,

original: kosajjaṃ abhibhavati. Balavavīriyaṃ mandasamādhiṃ vīriyassa uddhaccapakkhattā uddhaccaṃ🔽abhibhavati. Samādhi pana vīriyena saṃyojito kosajje patituṃ na labhati, vīriyaṃ
analyzed: kosajjam abhibhavati balava vīriyam manda samādhim vīriyassa uddhacca pakkhattā uddhaccam  abhibhavati vīriyena saṃyojitaḥ kosajje patitum na labhati vīriyam
translated: idleness overpowers him. And if energy is strong and concentration weak, then since restlessness is a near enemy of energy,

original: samādhinā saṃyojitaṃ uddhacce patituṃ na labhati. Tasmā tadubhayaṃ samaṃ kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: samādhinā saṃyojitam uddhacce patitum na labhati tasmai tat ubhayam samam kātabbam
translated: restlessness overpowers him. But when concentration is yoked with energy, idleness does not get a chance to overpower him; and when energy is yoked with concentration, restlessness does not get a chance to overpower him. So both should be made equal.

original: Ubhayasamatāya hi appanā hoti.🔽Api ca samādhikammikassa balavatīpi saddhā vaṭṭati. Evaṃ saddahanto okappento appanaṃ
analyzed: ubhaya samatāya hi appanā hoti  api ca samādhi kammikassa balavatī api saddhā vaṭṭati evam saddahantaḥ okappentaḥ appanam
translated: For it is by their equality that absorption is reached.🔽Moreover, in one whose temperament is that of concentration faith is strong. For one who has such faith and confidence will reach absorption.

original: pāpuṇissati. Samādhipaññāsu pana samādhikammikassa ekaggatā balavatī vaṭṭati. Evañhi
analyzed: pāpuṇissati samādhi paññāsu pana samādhi kammikassa ekagga tā balavatī vaṭṭati evam hi
translated: But in one whose temperament is that of understanding unification of mind is strong. For one who has such unification will reach understanding.

original: so appanaṃ pāpuṇāti. Vipassanākammikassa paññā balavatī vaṭṭati. Evañhi so lakkhaṇapaṭivedhaṃ
analyzed: so appanam pāpuṇāti vipassanā kammikassa paññā balavatī vaṭṭati evam hi so lakkhaṇa paṭivedham
translated: and he reaches absorption. But for one who is a “vision-worker” understanding is strong and necessary, for it is by means of that that he reaches penetration of the characteristics of the three aggregates beginning with feeling.

original: pāpuṇāti. Ubhinnaṃ pana samatāyapi appanā hotiyeva. Sati pana sabbattha balavatī
analyzed: pāpuṇāti ubhinnam pana appanā sati pana sabbattha balavatī
translated: But absorption is also found in both cases. But mindfulness is necessary everywhere,

original: vaṭṭati. Sati hi cittaṃ uddhaccapakkhikānaṃ saddhāvīriyapaññānaṃ vasena uddhaccapātato,🔽kosajjapakkhikena ca samādhinā kosajjapātato rakkhati. Tasmā sā loṇadhūpanaṃ viya
analyzed: vaṭṭati sati hi cittam uddhacca pakkhikānam saddhā vīriya paññānam vasena uddhacca pātato  kosajjapakkhikena ca samādhinā kosajja pātataḥ rakkhati tasmā sā loṇa dhūpanam viya
translated: for mindfulness guards the mind against the danger of agitation through faith, energy and understanding, which are on the side of agitation,🔽and against the danger of slackness through concentration, which is on the side of slackness, like salt and oil in curry and like the cook in the kitchen of a king who is a great connoisseur of flavours.

original: sabbabyañjanesu, sabbakammikaamacco viya ca sabbarājakiccesu sabbattha icchitabbā.
analyzed: sabba byañjanesu sabba kammika amaccaḥ viya ca sabba rāja kiccesu sabbattha icchitabbā
translated: So it is to be desired everywhere.

original: Tenāha “sati ca pana sabbatthikā vuttā bhagavatā. Kiṃ kāraṇā? Cittañhi satipaṭisaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: tena āha sati ca pana sabbatthikāḥ vuttāḥ bhagavatā kim kāraṇā cittam hi sati paṭisaraṇam
translated: Hence it is said: “Mindfulness is called ‘all-purpose’ by the Blessed One. Why? Because the mind has mindfulness as its refuge,

original: ārakkhapaccupaṭṭhānā ca sati, na vinā satiyā cittassa paggahaniggaho hotī”ti.
analyzed: ārakkha paccupaṭṭhānā ca sati na vinā satiyā cittassa paggaha niggaho hoti iti
translated: and because mindfulness is present as the protector of the mind, and because there is no rousing and guiding of the mind without mindfulness” .

original: Duppaññapuggalaparivajjanā nāma khandhādibhede anogāḷhapaññānaṃ dummedhapuggalānaṃ
analyzed: duppañña puggala parivajjanā nāma khandha ādi bhede anogāḷha paññānam dummedha puggalānam
translated: “Avoiding persons of foolish understanding” means avoiding foolish persons who are not skilled in the analysis of the aggregates, etc.,

original: ārakā parivajjanaṃ. Paññavantapuggalasevanā nāma samapaññāsalakkhaṇapariggāhikāya🔽udayabbayapaññāya samannāgatapuggalasevanā. Gambhīrañāṇacariyapaccavekkhaṇā nāma🔽gambhīresu khandhādīsu pavattāya gambhīrapaññāya pabhedapaccavekkhaṇā. Tadadhimuttatā
analyzed: ārakā parivajjanam paññavanta puggala sevanā nāma sama paññāsa lakkhaṇa pariggāhikāya  udaya bbaya paññāya samannāgata puggala sevanā gambhīra ñāṇa cariya paccavekkhaṇā nāma  gambhīresu khandha ādīsu pavattāya gambhīra paññāya pabheda paccavekkhaṇā tad adhimutta tā
translated: Keeping company with wise people is keeping company with people who have the understanding that discerns the characteristics of right and wrong views.🔽Reviewing the profound knowledge and the conduct is reviewing the various kinds of profound understanding that occurs in regard to the profound aggregates, etc.

original: nāma ṭhānanisajjādīsu dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgasamuṭṭhāpanatthaṃ ninnapoṇapabbhāracittatā.
analyzed: nāma ṭhāna nisajja ādīsu dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅga samuṭṭhāpana attham ninna poṇa pabbhāra citta tā
translated: Being devoted to that is the devotedness of one who is intent on arousing the enlightenment factor of discrimination of what is right and wrong in the various postures.

original: Evaṃ uppannassa panassa arahattamaggena bhāvanāpāripūrī hoti.
analyzed: evam uppannassa pana assa arahatta maggena bhāvanā pāripūrī hoti
translated: When it has arisen in this way, its fulfilment comes about with the attainment of Arahantship by means of the path of arahantship.

original: Ekādasa dhammā vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti – apāyabhayapaccavekkhaṇatā,
analyzed: ekādasa dhammā vīriya sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti apāya bhaya paccavekkhaṇa tā
translated: Eleven things lead to the arising of the enlightenment factor of energy: reviewing the fearfulness of the states of loss such as the hell realms,

original: ānisaṃsadassāvitā, gamanavīthipaccavekkhaṇatā, piṇḍapātāpacāyanatā, dāyajjamahattapaccavekkhaṇatā,
analyzed: ānisaṃsa dassāvi tā gamana vīthi paccavekkhaṇa tā piṇḍapāta apacāyana tā dāyajja mahatta paccavekkhaṇa tā
translated: seeing the benefits, reviewing the path, not being a glutton, reviewing the greatness of the heritage,

original: satthumahattapaccavekkhaṇatā, jātimahattapaccavekkhaṇatā, sabrahmacārimahattapaccavekkhaṇatā,
analyzed: satthu mahatta paccavekkhaṇa tā jāti mahatta paccavekkhaṇa tā sabrahmacāri mahatta paccavekkhaṇa tā
translated: reviewing the greatness of the Teacher, reviewing the greatness of the birth, reviewing the greatness of the companions in the divine life,

original: kusītapuggalaparivajjanatā, āraddhavīriyapuggalasevanatā, tadadhimuttatāti.
analyzed: kusīta puggala parivajjana tā āraddha vīriya puggala sevana tā tad adhimutta tā ati
translated: and avoidance of people who are lazy and cultivation of people who are energetic, and the inclination to that.

original: Tattha “nirayesu pañcavidhabandhanakammakāraṇato paṭṭhāya mahādukkhaṃ anubhavanakālepi,
analyzed: tattha nirayesu pañcavidha bandhana kamma kāraṇato paṭṭhāya mahā dukkham anubhavana kāle pi
translated: Herein, even when one is experiencing great suffering from the time of being taken to the place of impalement in the hells and being impaled on the five-fold stake,🔽even when one is caught by the nets, snares, weirs, etc., in the animal realm,

original: tiracchānayoniyaṃ jālakhipanakumīnādīhi gahitakālepi, pājanakaṇṭakādippahāratunnassa
analyzed: tiracchāna yoniyam jāla khipana kumīna ādīhi pājana kaṇṭaka ādi pahāra tunnassa
translated: even when one is being carried off in a cart, etc., in the realm of ghosts,

original: pana sakaṭavahanādikālepi, pettivisaye anekānipi vassasahassāni ekaṃ buddhantarampi🔽khuppipāsāhi āturībhūtakālepi, kālakañcikaasuresu saṭṭhihatthaasītihatthappamāṇena
analyzed: pana sakaṭa vahana ādi kāle pi petti visaye anekāni api vassa sahassāni ekam buddha antaram pi  khuppipāsāhi āturībhūta kāle api kālakañcika asuresu saṭṭhi hattha asīti hattha ppamāṇena
translated: even when one is afflicted with hunger and thirst for many thousands of years in the ghost realm, even for an interval between Buddhas,

original: aṭṭhicammamatteneva attabhāvena vātātapādidukkhānubhavanakālepi na sakkā vīriyasambojjhaṅgaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭhi camma mattena iva atta bhāvena vāta ātapa ādi dukkha anubhavana kāle pi na sakkā vīriya sambojjhaṅgam
translated: even when one is experiencing the suffering of wind and sun, etc., with a body consisting only of skin and bones eighty or a hundred leagues long in the Asura realm, one cannot arouse the enlightenment factor of energy.

original: uppādetuṃ. Ayameva te bhikkhu kālo”ti evaṃ apāyabhayaṃ paccavekkhantassāpi vīriyasambojjhaṅgo uppajjati.
analyzed: uppādetum ayam eva te bhikkhu kālaḥ ti evam apāya bhayam paccavekkhantassa api vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ uppajjati
translated: This is the time for you, bhikkhu,” then too the enlightenment factor of energy arises in him as he reflects on the danger in the states of loss.

original: “Na sakkā kusītena navalokuttaradhammaṃ laddhuṃ, āraddhavīriyeneva sakkā ayamānisaṃso
analyzed: na sakkā kusītena nava lokuttara dhammam laddhum āraddha vīriyena iva sakkā ayam ānisaṃso
translated: “One who is lazy cannot obtain the nine supramundane states; only one who is energetic can obtain them. This is the benefit,

original: vīriyassā”ti evaṃ ānisaṃsadassāvinopi uppajjati. “Sabbabuddha-paccekabuddha-mahāsāvakeheva
analyzed: vīriyassa ati evam ānisaṃsa dassāvinaḥ api uppajjati sabba buddha paccekabuddha mahāsāvakehi iva
translated: and so it arises in one who sees the benefits. “The path you have to go has been gone by all the Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and Great Disciples,

original: gatamaggo te gantabbo. So ca na sakkā kusītena gantu”nti evaṃ gamanavīthiṃ paccavekkhantassāpi uppajjati.
analyzed: gata maggaḥ te gantabbo so ca na sakkā kusītena gantun ti evam gamana vīthim paccavekkhantassa api uppajjati
translated: and that cannot be gone by one who is lazy.” And it arises in one who reflects on the path he has to go.

original: “Ye taṃ piṇḍapātādīhi upaṭṭhahanti, ime te manussā neva ñātakā, na dāsakammakarā,
analyzed: ye tam piṇḍapāta ādīhi upaṭṭhahanti ime te manussāḥ na iva ñātakāḥ na dāsa kammakarā
translated: “Those who serve you with alms food, etc., are not your relatives, nor are they slaves or servants,

original: nāpi ‘taṃ nissāya jīvissāmā’ti te paṇītāni piṇḍapātādīni denti. Atha kho attano kārānaṃ🔽mahapphalataṃ paccāsīsamānā denti. Satthārāpi “ayaṃ ime paccaye paribhuñjitvā kāyadaḷhibahulo
analyzed: na api tam nissāya jīvissāma ati te paṇītāni piṇḍapāta ādīni denti atha kho attanaḥ kārānam  mahapphalatam denti satthārā api ayam ime paccaye paribhuñjitvā kāya daḷhi bahulaḥ
translated: nor do they give you fine alms food, etc., thinking ‘We shall live depending on him.’ On the contrary, they give it as if making a deposit,

original: sukhaṃ viharissatī”ti na evaṃ sampassatā tuyhaṃ paccayā anuññātā, atha kho “ayaṃ
analyzed: sukham viharissati iti na evam sampassatā tuyham paccayāḥ anuññātāḥ atha kho ayaṃ
translated: thinking ‘We shall get great fruit.’ And the Master did not allow you these requisites thinking ‘He will make much of his body and live in comfort using these requisites.’

original: ime paribhuñjamānova samaṇadhammaṃ katvā vaṭṭadukkhato muccissatī’ti te paccayā anuññātā,
analyzed: ime paribhuñjamānaḥ iva samaṇa dhammam katvā vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ muccissati iti te paccayāḥ anuññātā
translated: On the contrary, he allowed them thinking ‘He will be able to make an end of suffering by becoming a recluse and by doing the ascetic’s duties while using these requisites.’

original: so dāni tvaṃ kusīto viharanto na taṃ piṇḍaṃ apacāyissasi, āraddhavīriyasseva hi piṇḍapātāpacāyanaṃ
analyzed: saḥ dāni tvam kusītaḥ viharantaḥ na tam piṇḍam apacāyissasi āraddha vīriyassa iva hi piṇḍapāta apacāyanam
translated: Now, as one who is lazy you will not even be able to eat that alms food. For it is only one who is energetic that can eat alms food.”

original: nāma hotī”ti evaṃ piṇḍapātāpacāyanaṃ paccavekkhantassāpi uppajjati mahāmittattherassa viya.
analyzed: nāma hoti iti evam piṇḍapāta apacāyanam paccavekkhantassa api uppajjati mahāmitta therassa viya
translated: So too, it arises in one who reflects on the fact that the eating of alms food is for one who is energetic, as it did in the Elder Mahā-Mitta.

original: Thero kira kassakaleṇe nāma paṭivasati. Tasseva gocaragāme ekā mahāupāsikā theraṃ🔽puttaṃ katvā paṭijaggati. Sā ekadivasaṃ araññaṃ gacchantī dhītaraṃ āha – “amma, asukasmiṃ
analyzed: theraḥ kira kassakaleṇe nāma paṭivasati tassa iva gocara gāme ekā mahā upāsikā theraṃ  puttam katvā paṭijaggati sā eka divasam araññam gacchantī dhītaram āha amma asukasmin
translated: The elder lived in a place called Kassaka-leṇā. In the same village where he went for alms there was a great female lay devotee

original: ṭhāne purāṇataṇḍulā, asukasmiṃ khīraṃ, asukasmiṃ sappi, asukasmiṃ phāṇitaṃ, tava
analyzed: ṭhāne purāṇa taṇḍulāḥ asukasmin khīram asukasmin sappi asukasmin phāṇitam tava
translated: who looked after the elder as if he were her son. One day as she was going to the forest she said to her daughter: “In such-and-such a place there are old grains of rice, in such-and-such a place there is milk, in such-and-such a place there is ghee, in such-and-such a place there is molasses.

original: bhātikassa ayyamittassa āgatakāle bhattaṃ pacitvā khīrasappiphāṇitehi saddhiṃ dehi,
analyzed: bhātikassa ayya mittassa āgata kāle bhattam pacitvā khīra sappi phāṇitehi saddhim dehi
translated: When your brother, the venerable Mitta, comes, cook him a meal and give it to him with the milk, ghee, and molasses.

original: tvañca bhuñjeyyāsi, ahaṃ pana hiyyo pakkaṃ pārivāsikabhattaṃ kañjiyena bhuttāmhī”ti.
analyzed: tvam ca bhuñjeyyāsi aham pana hiyyo pakkam pārivāsika bhattam kañjiyena bhuttāmhi iti
translated: You can eat it too. But yesterday I ate the rice gruel for the Invitation Day with dried ginger.”

original: “Divā kiṃ bhuñjissasi, ammā”ti? “Sākapaṇṇaṃ pakkhipitvā kaṇataṇḍulehi ambilayāguṃ
analyzed: divā kim bhuñjissasi amma ati sākapaṇṇam pakkhipitvā kaṇa taṇḍulehi ambila yāgum
translated: “What will you eat by day, mother?” “I will make a sour rice gruel with the old grains of rice and add a leaf of potherb to it.”

original: pacitvā ṭhapehi, ammā”ti.
analyzed: pacitvā ṭhapehi amma ati
translated: “Cook it and set it aside, my dear.”

original: Thero cīvaraṃ pārupitvā pattaṃ nīharantova taṃ saddaṃ sutvā attānaṃ ovadi “mahāupāsikā
analyzed: thero cīvaram pārupitvā pattam nīharantaḥ iva tam saddam sutvā attānam ovadi mahā upāsikā
translated: The Elder, having put on his robe and taken out his bowl, heard that sound. He admonished himself, “The great lay devotee,

original: kira kañjiyena pārivāsikabhattaṃ bhuñjitvā divāpi kaṇapaṇṇambilayāguṃ bhuñjissati,
analyzed: kira kañjiyena pārivāsika bhattam bhuñjitvā divā api kaṇa paṇṇambila yāgum bhuñjissati
translated: it seems, having eaten the food of a probationer with sour gruel, will eat in the daytime a gruel of rotten leaves.

original: tuyhaṃ atthāya pana purāṇataṇḍulādīni ācikkhati, taṃ nissāya kho panesā neva khettaṃ
analyzed: tuyham atthāya pana purāṇa taṇḍula ādīni ācikkhati tam nissāya kho pana esā na iva khettam
translated: But she has told you about old rice, etc., for your sake. She does not expect you to repay her in kind with a field,

original: na vatthuṃ na bhattaṃ na vatthaṃ paccāsīsati, tisso pana sampattiyo patthayamānā🔽deti, tvaṃ etissā tā sampattiyo dātuṃ sakkhissasi, na sakkhissasīti, ayaṃ kho pana
analyzed: na vatthum na bhattam na vattham paccāsīsati tissaḥ pana sampattiyaḥ patthayamānā  deti tvam etissā tā sampattiyaḥ dātum sakkhissasi na sakkhissasi iti ayam kho pana
translated: a house, food, or clothing. But she gives, hoping for the three kinds of success.🔽Will you be able to give her those successes or not?

original: piṇḍapāto tayā sarāgena sadosena samohena na sakkā gaṇhitu”nti pattaṃ thavikāya pakkhipitvā
analyzed: piṇḍapātaḥ tayā sa rāgena sa dosena sa mohena na sakkā gaṇhitunti pattam thavikāya pakkhipitvā
translated: This alms food cannot be taken by you as long as you are still with passion, hatred, and delusion.” He put his bowl in its bag,

original: gaṇṭhikaṃ muñcitvā nivattitvā kassakaleṇameva gantvā pattaṃ heṭṭhāmañce, cīvaraṃ
analyzed: gaṇṭhikam muñcitvā nivattitvā kassakaleṇam eva gantvā pattam heṭṭhā mañce cīvaram
translated: unfastened his waistband, turned back, and went to the farmer’s cave. He put his bowl on the lower terrace and his robe on the upper.

original: cīvaravaṃse ṭhapetvā “arahattaṃ apāpuṇitvā na nikkhamissāmī”ti vīriyaṃ adhiṭṭhahitvā
analyzed: cīvara vaṃse ṭhapetvā arahattam apāpuṇitvā na nikkhamissāmi iti vīriyam adhiṭṭhahitvā
translated: and he sat down, determined to make a strenuous effort and not to leave his seat until he had attained Arahantship.

original: nisīdi. Dīgharattaṃ appamatto hutvā nivutthabhikkhu vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā purebhattameva🔽arahattaṃ patvā vikasamānamiva padumaṃ mahākhīṇāsavo sitaṃ karontova nikkhami. Leṇadvāre
analyzed: nisīdi dīgharattam appamattaḥ hutvā nivuttha bhikkhu vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā purebhattam eva  arahattam patvā vikasamānam iva padumam mahā khīṇāsavaḥ sitam karontaḥ uva nikkhami leṇa dvāre
translated: After striving earnestly for a long time, he increased his insight and attained Arahantship in the forenoon.🔽Then, like a lotus that has blossomed, he went out of the cave,🔽and a deity who dwelt in a tree at the entrance to the cave

original: rukkhamhi adhivatthā devatā –
analyzed: rukkhamhi adhivatthā devatā
translated: paid homage to him with the following Stanza,

original: “Namo te purisājañña, namo te purisuttama;
analyzed: namaḥ te purisājañña namaḥ te purisuttama
translated: “Homage to thee, O man of vision! Homage to thee, O man supreme!

original: Yassa te āsavā khīṇā, dakkhiṇeyyosi mārisā”ti. –
analyzed: yassa te āsavā khīṇā dakkhiṇeyyā asi mārisa ati
translated: Since thy cankers are destroyed, thou art worthy, O man, to receive gifts.”

original: Udānaṃ udānetvā “bhante, piṇḍāya paviṭṭhānaṃ tumhādisānaṃ arahantānaṃ bhikkhaṃ datvā🔽mahallakitthiyo dukkhā muccissantī”ti āha. Thero uṭṭhahitvā dvāraṃ vivaritvā kālaṃ
analyzed: udānaṃ udānetvā bhante piṇḍāya paviṭṭhānam tumhādisānam arahantānam bhikkham datvā  mahallaka itthiyaḥ dukkhā muccissanti iti āha theraḥ uṭṭhahitvā dvāram vivaritvā kālam
translated: And the deity added, “Reverend Sir, if poor women give alms to such noble Arahants as you when you go out for alms,🔽they will be freed from their poverty.” The Elder rose up, opened the door,

original: olokento “pātoyevā”ti ñatvā pattacīvaraṃ ādāya gāmaṃ pāvisi.
analyzed: olokento pātoyā iva ati ñatvā patta cīvaram ādāya gāmam pāvisi
translated: and looked out to see what time it was. Seeing that it was still early, he took his bowl and outer robe and went into the village to gather alms.

original: Dārikāpi bhattaṃ sampādetvā “idāni me bhātā āgamissati, idāni āgamissatī”ti dvāraṃ
analyzed: dārikā api bhattam sampādetvā idāni me bhātā āgamissati idāni āgamissati iti dvāram
translated: The girl, too, prepared the meal, and standing at the door, said, “Now my brother will come; now he will come.”

original: olokayamānā nisīdi. Sā there gharadvāraṃ sampatte pattaṃ gahetvā sappiphāṇitayojitassa
analyzed: olokayamānā nisīdi sā there ghara dvāram sampatte pattam gahetvā sappi phāṇita yojitassa
translated: and sat down watching him. When the Elder reached the door of the house, she took his bowl, filled it with a milk-rice offering mixed with ghee and molasses,

original: khīrapiṇḍapātassa pūretvā hatthe ṭhapesi. Thero “sukhaṃ hotū”ti anumodanaṃ katvā
analyzed: khīra piṇḍapātassa pūretvā hatthe ṭhapesi thero sukham hotu iti anumodanam katvā
translated: and placed it in his hands. The Elder pronounced the words of thanksgiving, saying, “May you be happy.”

original: pakkāmi. Sāpi taṃ olokayamānāva aṭṭhāsi. Therassa hi tadā ativiya parisuddho chavivaṇṇo
analyzed: pakkāmi sā api tam olokayamānā iva aṭṭhāsi therassa hi tadā parisuddhaḥ chavi vaṇṇo
translated: Then he departed. She stood watching him as he went away. For at that moment the Elder’s skin was exceedingly clear and bright,

original: ahosi, vippasannāni indriyāni, mukhaṃ bandhanā muttatālapakkaṃ viya ativiya virocittha.
analyzed: ahosi vippasannāni indriyāni mukham bandhanā mutta tālapakkam viya ativiya virocittha
translated: his faculties were exceedingly clear, and his face shone like a ripe palm-nut freed from its rind.

original: Mahāupāsikā araññato āgantvā “kiṃ, amma, bhātiko te āgato”ti pucchi. Sā sabbaṃ taṃ
analyzed: mahā upāsikā araññataḥ āgantvā kim amma bhātiko te āgato ti pucchi sā sabbam tam
translated: The lay devotee returned from the forest and asked, “Sister, has your brother come?” She told her all that had happened.

original: pavattiṃ ārocesi. Upāsikā “ajja me puttassa pabbajitakiccaṃ matthakaṃ patta”nti ñatvā
analyzed: pavattim ārocesi upāsikā ajja me puttassa pabbajita kiccam matthakam pattanti ñatvā
translated: The lay devotee thought to herself, “To-day my son has completed the duties of a monk,”

original: “abhiramati te, amma, bhātā buddhasāsane, na ukkaṇṭhatī”ti āha.
analyzed: abhiramati te amma bhātā buddha sāsane na ukkaṇṭhati iti āha
translated: and said, “Sister, your brother delights in the Dispensation of the Buddha; he is not discontented.”

original: “Mahantaṃ kho panetaṃ satthudāyajjaṃ, yadidaṃ satta ariyadhanāni nāma, taṃ na sakkā
analyzed: mahantam kho pana itam satthu dāyajjam yat idam satta ariya dhanāni nāma tam na sakkā
translated: “But, sister, the great gift of the Teacher is the seven treasures of the Ariyan;

original: kusītena gahetuṃ. Yathā hi vippaṭipannaṃ puttaṃ mātāpitaro ‘ayaṃ amhākaṃ aputto’ti
analyzed: kusītena gahetum yathā hi vippaṭipannam puttam mātā pitaraḥ ayam amhākam a puttaḥ ti
translated: and it is not for the lazy to take. For just as parents make their wayward son an outsider by saying, “He is not our son,”

original: paribāhiraṃ karonti, so tesaṃ accayena dāyajjaṃ na labhati, evaṃ kusītopi idaṃ ariyadhanadāyajjaṃ🔽na labhati, āraddhavīriyova labhatī”ti dāyajjamahattaṃ paccavekkhatopi uppajjati.
analyzed: paribāhiram karonti saḥ tesam accayena dāyajjam na labhati evam kusītaḥ api idam ariya dhana dāyajjam  na labhati āraddha vīriyaḥ uva labhati iti dāyajja mahattam paccavekkhato pi uppajjati
translated: and he does not get his inheritance, so too the lazy man does not get this inheritance of the ariyan riches.

original: “Mahā kho pana te satthā, satthuno hi te mātukucchismiṃ paṭisandhiggahaṇakālepi abhinikkhamanepi🔽abhisambodhiyampi dhammacakkappavattana-yamakapāṭihāriya-devorohana-āyusaṅkhāravossajjanesupi
analyzed: mahā kho pana te satthā satthunaḥ hi te mātukucchismim paṭisandhi ggahaṇa kāle api abhinikkhamane pi  abhisambodhiyam pi dhamma cakka ppavattana yamaka pāṭihāriya deva ārohana āyu saṅkhāra vossajjanesu pi
translated: It arises too in one who reflects on the greatness of the inheritance: “Your teacher is great, it seems,

original: parinibbānakālepi dasasahassilokadhātu akampittha. Yuttaṃ nu kho te evarūpassa satthu
analyzed: parinibbāna kāle pi dasa sahassi lokadhātu akampittha yuttam nu kho te evarūpassa satthu
translated: for when he took rebirth-linking in your mother’s womb, when he went forth, when he reached supreme enlightenment, when he set in motion the Wheel of the Dhamma, when he performed the Twin Miracle, when he descended from the Tāvatimsa gods, when he relinquished his vital force, and when he finally attained to the complete extinction of the elements of being that constitute the personality, the ten-thousandfold world system shook.

original: sāsane pabbajitvā kusītena bhavitu”nti evaṃ satthumahattaṃ paccavekkhatopi uppajjati.
analyzed: sāsane pabbajitvā kusītena bhavitun ti evam satthu mahattam paccavekkhataḥ api uppajjati
translated: Is it proper for you, who have gone forth under such a Teacher, to be lazy?”

original: “Jātiyāpi tvaṃ idāni na lāmakajātiko, asambhinnāya mahāsammatapaveṇiyā āgataukkākarājavaṃse
analyzed: jātiyā api tvam idāni na lāmaka jātikaḥ asambhinnāya mahāsammata paveṇiyā āgata okkāka rāja vaṃse
translated: “You are not now of low birth. You are born in the line of the kings of Ukkala, which is unbroken and goes back to Mahāsammata himself.

original: jātosi, suddhodanamahārājassa ca mahāmāyādeviyā ca nattā, rāhulabhaddassa kaniṭṭho,
analyzed: jātaḥ asi suddhodana mahā rājassa ca mahāmāyā deviyā ca nattā rāhulabhaddassa kaniṭṭhaḥ
translated: You are the grandson of King Suddhodana and Queen Mahāmāyā, the younger brother of Rāhula,

original: tayā nāma evarūpena jinaputtena hutvā na yuttaṃ kusītena viharitu”nti evaṃ jātimahattaṃ
analyzed: tayā nāma evarūpena jinaputtena hutvā na yuttam kusītena viharitun ti evam jāti mahattam
translated: It is not right for one who is a son of the Conqueror to live indolently.”

original: paccavekkhatopi uppajjati.
analyzed: paccavekkhato pi uppajjati
translated: It arises too when he reflects on the greatness of his fellow brahma-farers thus:

original: “Sāriputtamoggallānā ceva asīti mahāsāvakā ca vīriyeneva lokuttaradhammaṃ paṭivijjhiṃsu.
analyzed: sāriputta moggallānā ca iva asi iti mahāsāvakā ca vīriyena iva lokuttara dhammam paṭivijjhiṃsu
translated: “Sāriputta and Moggallāna and the eighty great disciples penetrated the supramundane state by energy.

original: Tvaṃ pana etesaṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ maggaṃ paṭipajjasi, na paṭipajjasī”ti evaṃ sabrahmacārimahattaṃ🔽paccavekkhatopi uppajjati.🔽Kucchiṃ pūretvā ṭhitaajagarasadise vissaṭṭhakāyikacetasikavīriye kusītapuggale parivajjentassāpi,
analyzed: tvam pana etesam sabrahmacārīnam maggam paṭipajjasi na paṭipajjasi iti evam sabrahmacāri mahattam  paccavekkhato pi uppajjati  kucchim pūretvā ṭhita ajagara sadise vissaṭṭha kāyika cetasika vīriye kusīta puggale parivajjentassa api
translated: Are you, a fellow brahma-farer of these, following the path or not?”🔽It arises too when he avoids lazy people whose bodily and mental energy is dissipated like a sluggish serpent and resorts to energetic people who are intent on their work,

original: āraddhavīriye pahitatte puggale sevantassāpi ṭhānanisajjādīsu vīriyuppādanatthaṃ
analyzed: āraddha vīriye pahita tte puggale sevantassa api ṭhāna nisajja ādīsu vīriya uppādana attham
translated: and when he makes sure that his bodily and mental energy is aroused in whatever posture he happens to be in,

original: ninnapoṇapabbhāracittassāpi uppajjati. Evaṃ uppannassa panassa arahattamaggena bhāvanāpāripūrī hoti.
analyzed: ninna poṇa pabbhāra cittassa api uppajjati evam uppannassa pana assa arahatta maggena bhāvanā pāripūrī hoti
translated: When it has arisen in this way, its development to culmination comes about with the Arahant path.

original: Ekādasa dhammā pītisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti – buddhānussati dhammo, saṅgho,
analyzed: ekādasa dhammā pīti sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti buddha anussati dhammaḥ saṅgho
translated: Eleven ideas are conducive to the arising of the Joyful-Interest factor of Complete Awakening: the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dhamma, the recollection of the Sangha,

original: sīlaṃ, cāgo, devatānussati, upasamānussati, lūkhapuggalaparivajjanatā, siniddhapuggalasevanatā,
analyzed: sīlam cāgaḥ devatā anussati upasama anussati lūkha puggala parivajjana tā siniddha puggala sevana tā
translated: recollection of virtue, recollection of generosity, recollection of the divine, recollection of peace, avoidance of rough people, cultivation of refined people,

original: pasādanīyasuttantapaccavekkhaṇatā, tadadhimuttatāti.
analyzed: pasādanīya suttanta paccavekkhaṇa tā tad adhimutta tā ti
translated: reviewing inspiring discourses, and resoluteness upon that.

original: Buddhaguṇe anussarantassāpi hi yāva upacārā sakalasarīraṃ pharamāno pītisambojjhaṅgo
analyzed: buddha guṇe anussarantassa api hi yāva upacārā sakala sarīram pharamānaḥ pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ
translated: For the Joyful-Interest factor of Complete Awakening arises in one who recollects the special qualities of the Enlightened One, pervading his whole body with the happiness and gladness born of that recollection,

original: uppajjati, dhammasaṅghaguṇe anussarantassāpi, dīgharattaṃ akhaṇḍaṃ katvā rakkhitaṃ
analyzed: uppajjati dhamma saṅgha guṇe anussarantassa api dīgharattam akhaṇḍam katvā rakkhitam
translated: and in one who recollects the special qualities of the True Idea, the Community, virtue, generosity, the divine, and peace,🔽and in one who reviews his own virtue that has long been kept unbroken,

original: catupārisuddhisīlaṃ paccavekkhantassāpi, gihino dasasīlapañcasīlāni paccavekkhantassāpi,
analyzed: catu pārisuddhi sīlam paccavekkhantassa api gihinaḥ dasa sīla pañca sīlāni paccavekkhantassa api
translated: and in one who reviews the ten- or five-fold virtue of a lay follower,

original: dubbhikkhabhayādīsu paṇītaṃ bhojanaṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ datvā “evaṃ nāma adamhā”ti cāgaṃ
analyzed: dubbhikkha bhaya ādīsu paṇītam bhojanam da tvā evam nāma cāgam
translated: and in one who, at a time of famine, for instance, gives food to his companions in the life of purity and then recollects that generosity,

original: paccavekkhantassāpi, gihinopi evarūpe kāle sīlavantānaṃ dinnadānaṃ paccavekkhantassāpi,
analyzed: paccavekkhantassa api gihino pi evarūpe kāle sīlavantānam dinna dānam paccavekkhantassa api
translated: and when he reviews the generosity of the virtuous at such times,

original: yehi guṇehi samannāgatā devattaṃ pattā, tathārūpānaṃ attani atthitaṃ paccavekkhantassāpi,
analyzed: yehi guṇehi samannāgatāḥ devattam pattā tathārūpānam attani atthitam paccavekkhantassa api
translated: and when he reviews the presence in himself of the qualities that lead to rebirth in the world of the gods,

original: samāpattiyā vikkhambhitā kilesā saṭṭhipi sattatipi vassāni na samudācarantīti paccavekkhantassāpi,🔽cetiyadassanabodhidassanatheradassanesu asakkaccakiriyāya saṃsūcitalūkhabhāve buddhādīsu
analyzed: samāpattiyā vikkhambhitāḥ kilesā saṭṭhipi sattatipi vassāni na samudācaranti iti paccavekkhantassa api  cetiya dassana bodhi dassana thera dassanesu asakkacca kiriyāya saṃsūcita lūkha bhāve buddha ādīsu
translated: and when he reviews the fact that the defilements suppressed by the attainment do not recur for sixty or seventy years,🔽and when he avoids rough people who are not respectful in paying homage at shrines, at the Bodhi Tree, and to elders, who are like the dust on the feet of the ass,

original: pasādasinehābhāvena gadrabhapiṭṭharajasadise lūkhapuggale parivajjentassāpi, buddhādīsu🔽pasādabahule muducitte siniddhapuggale sevantassāpi, ratanattayaguṇaparidīpake pasādanīye
analyzed: pasāda sineha abhāvena gadrabha piṭṭha raja sadise lūkha puggale buddha ādīsu  pasāda bahule mudu citte siniddha puggale sevantassa api pasādanīye
translated: and when he associates with gentle people who have faith in the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha, who are like the cream on the top of fresh butter,🔽and when he reviews the inspiring discourses that reveal the special qualities of the Three Jewels,

original: suttante paccavekkhantassāpi, ṭhānanisajjādīsu pītiuppādanatthaṃ ninnapoṇapabbhāracittassāpi
analyzed: suttante paccavekkhantassa api ṭhāna nisajja ādīsu pīti uppādana attham ninna poṇa pabbhāra cittassa api
translated: and when he is inclined to humility in the postures in order to arouse rapture.

original: uppajjati. Evaṃ uppannassa panassa arahattamaggena bhāvanāpāripūrī hoti.
analyzed: uppajjati evam uppannassa pana assa arahatta maggena bhāvanā pāripūrī hoti
translated: and it arises in him. But its fulfilment is through the path of arahatship.

original: Satta dhammā passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti – paṇītabhojanasevanatā,
analyzed: satta dhammā passaddhi sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti paṇīta bhojana sevana tā
translated: Seven things lead to the arising of the tranquillity enlightenment factor:🔽using superior food,🔽using what is suitable as to climate, using what is suitable as to posture,

original: utusukhasevanatā, iriyāpathasukhasevanatā, majjhattapayogatā, sāraddhakāyapuggalaparivajjanatā,
analyzed: utu sukha sevana tā iriyāpatha sukha sevana tā majjhatta payoga tā sāraddha kāya puggala parivajjana tā
translated: using moderation in activities, avoiding persons of the sort that are unbeneficial,

original: passaddhakāya-puggalasevanatā, tadadhimuttatāti.🔽Paṇītañhi siniddhaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjantassāpi, sītuṇhesu utūsu ṭhānādīsu ca iriyāpathesu
analyzed: passaddha kāya puggala sevana tā tad adhimutta tā ati  paṇītam hi siniddham bhojanam bhuñjantassa api sītuṇhesu utūsu ṭhāna ādīsu ca iriyāpathesu
translated: associating with persons of the sort that are beneficial, and the will to that.

original: sappāyaṃ utuñca iriyāpathañca sevantassāpi passaddhi uppajjati. Yo pana mahāpurisajātiko
analyzed: sappāyam utuñca iriyāpathañca sevantassa api passaddhi uppajjati yaḥ pana mahāpurisa jātiko
translated: For when one uses superior, soft, refined food, and when one uses a climate and posture that are suitable, and when one uses moderation in activities, then tranquillity arises. But one who is of the great man type

original: sabbautuiriyāpathakkhamova hoti, na taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ. Yassa sabhāgavisabhāgatā
analyzed: hoti na tam sandhāya itam vuttam yassa sabhāga visabhāga tā
translated: is capable of enduring all climates and postures, and it is not with reference to him that this is said. It arises in one who has a suitable and an unsuitable type,🔽when he avoids the unsuitable climate and posture and uses the suitable ones.

original: atthi, tasseva visabhāge utuiriyāpathe vajjetvā sabhāge sevantassa uppajjati. Majjhattapayogo
analyzed: atthi tassa iva visabhāge utu iriyāpathe vajjetvā sabhāge sevantassa uppajjati majjhatta payogo
translated: Using moderation in activities.

original: vuccati attano ca parassa ca kammassakatapaccavekkhaṇā. Iminā majjhattapayogena uppajjati.
analyzed: vuccati attanaḥ ca parassa ca iminā majjhatta payogena uppajjati
translated: It is called “the reviewing of one’s own and others’ work as one’s own affair.” It arises with the middle way of action as its ground.🔽It arises too in one who avoids a person of the kind described in the way beginning, “When he sees such a person coming in the distance” ,

original: Yo leḍḍudaṇḍādīhi paraṃ viheṭhayamānova vicarati, evarūpaṃ sāraddhakāyapuggalaṃ parivajjentassāpi,🔽saṃyatapādapāṇiṃ passaddhakāyaṃ puggalaṃ sevantassāpi, ṭhānanisajjādīsu passaddhiuppādanatthāya
analyzed: yaḥ leḍḍu daṇḍa ādīhi param viheṭhayamānaḥ iva vicarati evarūpam sāraddha kāya puggalam  saṃyata pāda pāṇim passaddha kāyam puggalam sevantassa api ṭhāna nisajja ādīsu passaddhi uppādana tthāya
translated: and in one who resorts to a person of the kind described in the way beginning, “When he sees such a person coming in the distance” ,

original: ninnapoṇapabbhāracittassāpi uppajjati. Evaṃ uppannassa panassa arahattamaggena bhāvanāpāripūrī hoti.
analyzed: ninna poṇa pabbhāra cittassa api uppajjati evam uppannassa pana assa arahatta maggena bhāvanā pāripūrī hoti
translated: and in one who, in the postures of standing, walking, sitting, and lying down, has a mind that is low, humble, and respectful, for the purpose of producing serenity. When it has arisen in this way, its fulfilment comes with the attainment of the path of arahatship.

original: Dasa dhammā samādhisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti – vatthuvisadakiriyatā, indriyasamattapaṭipādanatā,🔽nimittakusalatā, samaye cittassa paggaṇhanatā, samaye cittassa niggaṇhanatā, samaye
analyzed: dasa dhammā samādhi sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti vatthu visada kiriya tā indriya samatta paṭipādana tā  nimitta kusala tā samaye cittassa paggaṇhana tā samaye cittassa niggaṇhana tā samaye
translated: Ten things lead to the arising of the enlightenment factor of concentration: purification of the physical support, balancing of the faculties,🔽skill in the sign, exertion of the mind at the proper time, restraining of the mind at the proper time,

original: sampahaṃsanatā, samaye ajjhupekkhanatā, asamāhitapuggalaparivajjanatā, samāhitapuggalasevanatā,
analyzed: sampahaṃsana tā samaye ajjhupekkhana tā asamāhita puggala parivajjana tā samāhita puggala sevana tā
translated: encouraging of the mind at the proper time, looking on with equanimity at the proper time, avoiding of persons who are not fully developed, associating with persons who are fully developed,

original: tadadhimuttatāti. Tattha vatthuvisadakiriyatā ca indriyasamattapaṭipādanatā ca vuttanayeneva veditabbā.
analyzed: tad adhimutta tā ti tattha vatthu visada kiriya tā ca indriya samatta paṭipādana tā ca vutta nayena iva veditabbā
translated: “He is intent upon that”: here the clearing of the object and the balancing of the faculties should be understood in the way already described.🔽“Skill in the sign”: skill in apprehending the sign of the kasiṇa.

original: Nimittakusalatā nāma kasiṇanimittassa uggahaṇakusalatā. Samaye cittassa paggaṇhanatāti
analyzed: nimitta kusala tā nāma kasiṇa nimittassa uggahaṇa kusala tā samaye cittassa paggaṇhana tā ti
translated: “At the time of exerting the mind”:

original: yasmiṃ samaye atisithilavīriyatādīhi līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayavīriyapītisambojjhaṅgasamuṭṭhāpanena
analyzed: yasmin samaye ati sithila vīriya tā ādīhi līnam cittam hoti tasmin samaye dhamma vicaya vīriya pīti sambojjhaṅga samuṭṭhāpanena
translated: when the mind is slack through excessive slackness of energy, etc., then by arousing the enlightenment factors of investigation of dhammas, energy, and rapture,🔽he exerts the mind.

original: tassa paggaṇhanaṃ. Samaye cittassa niggaṇhanatāti yasmiṃ samaye accāraddhavīriyatādīhi
analyzed: tassa paggaṇhanam samaye cittassa niggaṇhana tā ati yasmin samaye acca āraddha vīriya tā ādīhi
translated: “At the time of restraining the mind”: when the mind is restless through excessive energy, etc.,🔽then by arousing the enlightenment factors of tranquillity, concentration, and equanimity,

original: uddhataṃ cittaṃ hoti, tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisamādhiupekkhāsambojjhaṅgasamuṭṭhāpanena
analyzed: uddhatam cittam hoti tasmin samaye passaddhi samādhi upekkhā sambojjhaṅga samuṭṭhāpanena
translated: he restrains the mind.

original: tassa niggaṇhanaṃ. Samaye sampahaṃsanatāti yasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ paññāpayogamandatāya
analyzed: tassa niggaṇhanam samaye sampahaṃsana tā ati yasmin samaye cittam paññā apayoga manda tāya
translated: “At the time of encouraging the mind”: when the mind is dispirited through weakness in the application of wisdom

original: vā upasamasukhānaṃ vigamena vā nirassādaṃ hoti, tasmiṃ samaye aṭṭhasaṃvegavatthupaccavekkhaṇena
analyzed: vā upasama sukhānam vigamena vā nirassādam hoti tasmin samaye aṭṭha saṃvega vatthu paccavekkhaṇena
translated: or through the absence of the bliss of peace, then by reviewing the eight reasons for arousing enthusiasm,

original: saṃvejeti. Aṭṭha saṃvegavatthūni nāma jātijarābyādhimaraṇāni cattāri, apāyadukkhaṃ
analyzed: saṃveja iti aṭṭha saṃvega vatthūni nāma jāti jarā byādhi maraṇāni cattāri apāya dukkham
translated: He is stirred. The eight grounds for a sense of urgency are the four, birth, ageing, sickness, and death, and the five, the suffering of the states of loss,

original: pañcamaṃ, atīte vaṭṭamūlakaṃ dukkhaṃ, anāgate vaṭṭamūlakaṃ dukkhaṃ, paccuppanne āhārapariyeṭṭhimūlakaṃ
analyzed: pañcamam atīte vaṭṭa mūlakam dukkham anāgate vaṭṭa mūlakam dukkham paccuppanne āhāra pariyeṭṭhi mūlakam
translated: the suffering of the round in the past, the suffering of the round in the future, and the suffering of search for requisites in the present.

original: dukkhanti. Ratanattayaguṇānussaraṇena ca pasādaṃ janeti, ayaṃ vuccati “samaye sampahaṃsanatā”ti.🔽Samaye ajjhupekkhanatā nāma yasmiṃ samaye sammāpaṭipattiṃ āgamma alīnaṃ anuddhataṃ
analyzed: ca pasādam janeti ayam vuccati samaye sampahaṃsana tā ati  samaye ajjhupekkhanatā nāma yasmin samaye sammāpaṭipattim āgamma alīnam anuddhatam
translated: And he generates confidence by recollecting the special qualities of the Three Jewels. This is called “encouragement at the proper time.”🔽“Equanimity towards things that can be relied on” is the name for the equanimity of a meditator who, when he has arrived at the right way, and his mind occurs evenly occupied with its object without being depressed or restless,

original: anirassādaṃ ārammaṇe samappavattaṃ samathavīthipaṭipannaṃ cittaṃ hoti, tadāssa paggahaniggahasampahaṃsanesu
analyzed: a nirassādam ārammaṇe sama ppavattam samatha vīthi paṭipannam cittam hoti tadā assa paggaha niggaha sampahaṃsanesu
translated: without being over-hasty, and has entered upon a path of rightness, does not then concern himself with rousing, or with steadying, or with encouraging,

original: na byāpāraṃ āpajjati sārathi viya samappavattesu assesu. Ayaṃ vuccati “samaye ajjhupekkhanatā”ti.
analyzed: na byāpāram āpajjati sārathi viya sama pavattesu assesu ayam vuccati samaye ajjhupekkhanatā ati
translated: but is like a charioteer when his well-trained horses are going evenly. This is called “equanimity towards things that can be relied on.”

original: Asamāhitapuggalaparivajjanatā nāma upacāraṃ vā appanaṃ vā appattānaṃ vikkhittacittānaṃ
analyzed: asamāhita puggala parivajjana tā nāma upacāram vā appanam vā appattānam vikkhitta cittānam
translated: “Avoiding people who are not fully developed” is the name for the avoiding of people whose minds are distracted and who have not reached access concentration or absorption concentration.

original: puggalānaṃ ārakā parivajjanaṃ. Samāhitapuggalasevanatā nāma upacārena vā appanāya🔽vā samāhitacittānaṃ sevanā bhajanā payirupāsanā. Tadadhimuttatā nāma ṭhānanisajjādīsu
analyzed: puggalānam ārakā parivajjanam samāhita puggala sevana tā nāma upacārena vā appanāya  vā samāhita cittānam sevanā bhajanā payiḥ upāsanā tad adhimutta tā nāma ṭhāna nisajja ādīsu
translated: and keeping far away from people who are not concentrated.🔽“Keeping company with people who are concentrated”: frequenting, associating with, honouring, attending on people whose minds are concentrated either by access concentration or by absorption concentration.🔽“Inclination towards that”: the state of one whose mind is bent on, is inclined towards, is intent upon, is resolved upon, the arousing of concentration in the various postures of standing, sitting, etc.

original: samādhiuppādanatthameva ninnapoṇapabbhāracittatā. Evañhi paṭipajjato esa uppajjati.
analyzed: samādhi uppādana attham eva ninna poṇa pabbhāra citta tā evam hi paṭipajjataḥ esaḥ uppajjati
translated: For this concentration arises in one who practices in this way.

original: Evaṃ uppannassa panassa arahattamaggena bhāvanāpāripūrī hoti.
analyzed: evam uppannassa pana assa arahatta maggena bhāvanā pāripūrī hoti
translated: And when it has arisen, its development to Arahantship is due to the path of Arahantship.

original: Pañca dhammā upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti – sattamajjhattatā, saṅkhāramajjhattatā,
analyzed: pañca dhammā upekkhā sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattanti satta majjhatta tā saṅkhāra majjhatta tā
translated: Five things lead to the arising of the equanimity enlightenment factor: equanimity about formations, equanimity about feelings,

original: sattasaṅkhārakelāyanapuggalaparivajjanatā, sattasaṅkhāramajjhattapuggalasevanatā,
analyzed: satta saṅkhāra kelāyana puggala parivajjana tā satta saṅkhāra majjhatta puggala sevana tā
translated: avoiding people who are not of the right kind by nature, keeping company with people who are of the right kind by nature,

original: tadadhimuttatāti. Tattha dvīhākārehi sattamajjhattataṃ samuṭṭhāpeti – “tvaṃ attanova
analyzed: tad adhimutta tā ti tattha dvīhā ākārehi sattam ajjhattatam samuṭṭhāpeti tvam
translated: and inclination towards that. Herein, equanimity about formations is of two kinds: equanimity about formations as formations and equanimity about formations as a state.🔽“You have come by your own action,

original: kammena āgantvā attanova kammena gamissasi, esopi attano kammena āgantvā attanova
analyzed: kammena āgantvā attanā uva kammena gamissasi eso upi attanā kammena āgantvā attanā uva
translated: and you will go by your own action. This one has come by his own action,🔽and he will go by his own action. He has no concern with my coming or going.

original: kammena gamissati, tvaṃ kaṃ kelāyasī”ti evaṃ kammassakatapaccavekkhaṇena ca – “paramatthato
analyzed: kammena gamissati tvam kam kelāyasi iti evam kammassakata paccavekkhaṇena ca paramatthato
translated: “You will go by kamma, whom do you blame?”🔽🔽

original: sattoyeva natthi, so tvaṃ kaṃ kelāyasī”ti evaṃ nissattapaccavekkhaṇena ca. Dvīhevākārehi🔽saṅkhāramajjhattataṃ samuṭṭhāpeti – “idaṃ cīvaraṃ anupubbena vaṇṇavikāratañceva jiṇṇabhāvañca🔽upagantvā pādapuñchanacoḷakaṃ hutvā yaṭṭhikoṭiyā chaḍḍanīyaṃ bhavissati, sace panassa🔽sāmiko bhaveyya, nāyaṃ evaṃ vinassituṃ dadeyyā”ti evaṃ assāmikabhāvapaccavekkhaṇena
analyzed: natthi so tvam kam kelāyasi iti evam nissatta paccavekkhaṇena ca dvīhi iva ākārehi  saṅkhāram ajjhatta tam samuṭṭhāpeti idam cīvaram anupubbena vaṇṇa vikāra tañca iva jiṇṇa bhāvañca  upagantvā pāda puñchana coḷakam hutvā yaṭṭhi koṭiyā chaḍḍanīyam bhavissati sace pana assa  sāmikaḥ bhaveyya na ayam evam vinassitum dadeyya ati evam a ssāmika bhāva paccavekkhaṇena
translated: and by reviewing the fact that he will go by kamma, “Whom do you cheat?” and by reviewing the absence of a living being, “In the ultimate sense there is no living being at all, so whom do you cheat?”

original: ca, “anaddhaniyaṃ idaṃ tāvakālika”nti evaṃ tāvakālikabhāvapaccavekkhaṇena ca. Yathā
analyzed: ca idam tāvakālikan ti evam tāvakālika bhāva paccavekkhaṇena ca yathā
translated: He arouses the equanimity about formations in two ways: by reviewing the fact that it has no owner, “This robe will eventually undergo a change of colour and become worn and torn, and then it will be thrown on the dust-heap in the street to be used as cotton-waste,” and by reviewing the fact that it is temporary, “It is not wealth that can be stored up; it is only a temporary possession.”

original: ca cīvare, evaṃ pattādīsupi yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: ca cīvare evam patta ādīsu pi yojanā kātabbā
translated: And as with the robe, so too with the alms food, etc.,

original: Sattasaṅkhārakelāyanapuggalaparivajjanatāti ettha yo puggalo gihi vā attano puttadhītādike,
analyzed: satta saṅkhāra kelāyana puggala parivajjana tā ti ettha yaḥ puggalaḥ vā attano putta dhīta ādike
translated: The avoidance of persons who cheat in gambling with the six sense- bases: here a person may cheat his own children and wife, etc.,

original: pabbajito vā attano antevāsikasamānupajjhāyakādike mamāyati, sahatthāva nesaṃ kesacchedana-sūcikamma-cīvaradhovana-rajana-pattapacanādīni🔽karoti, muhuttampi apassanto “asuko sāmaṇero kuhiṃ, asuko daharo kuhi”nti bhantamigo
analyzed: pabbajitaḥ vā attanaḥ antevāsika samāna upajjhāyaka ādike mamāyati sahatthā va nesam kesa chedana sūci kamma cīvara dhovana rajana patta pacana ādīni  karoti muhuttam pi a passantaḥ asukaḥ sāmaṇeraḥ kuhim asukaḥ daharaḥ kuhinti bhantamigo
translated: If one who has gone forth thinks of his own pupils, students, etc., as “mine,” and does himself such services as shaving the hair, sewing robes, washing and dyeing them, cooking rice, etc.,

original: viya ito cito ca āloketi, aññena kesacchedanādīnaṃ atthāya “muhuttaṃ tāva asukaṃ
analyzed: viya itas citas ca āloketi aññena kesa chedana ādīnam atthāya muhuttam tāva asukam
translated: and if he looks about here and there like a lost man, saying, “Where is so-and-so, the novice? Where is so-and-so, the young bhikkhu?” when he cannot see them for a moment,

original: pesethā”ti yāciyamānopi “amhepi taṃ attano kammaṃ na kārema, tumhe naṃ gahetvā kilamessathā”ti
analyzed: pesetha ati yāciyamānaḥ api amhe pi tam attano kammam na kārema tumhe nam gahetvā kilamessatha ati
translated: and if he refuses to let another person send someone for a moment to do such things as shaving the hair, saying, “We would not do your work for you; you will have to do it yourself,”

original: na deti, ayaṃ sattakelāyano nāma. Yo pana cīvarapattathālakakattarayaṭṭhiādīni mamāyati,🔽aññassa hatthena parāmasitumpi na deti, tāvakālikaṃ yācitopi “mayampi imaṃ dhanāyantā
analyzed: na deti ayam sattakelāyanaḥ nāma yaḥ pana cīvara patta thālaka kattara yaṭṭhi ādīni mamāyati  aññassa hatthena parāmasitum pi na deti tāvakālikam yācitaḥ upi mayam pi imam dhanāyantā
translated: this is called the sevenfold miserliness. But if one thinks of one’s robes, bowl, bamboo carrying-net, water- strainer, etc., as “mine,”🔽and does not allow another to touch them even with his hand, and if he is asked to use something temporarily and says, “We do not use this as our own property; what shall we give you?”

original: na paribhuñjāma, tumhākaṃ kiṃ dassāmā”ti vadati, ayaṃ saṅkhārakelāyano nāma. Yo pana
analyzed: na paribhuñjāma tumhākam kim dassāma ati vadati ayam saṅkhārakelāyanaḥ nāma yaḥ pana
translated: this is called the eightfold miserliness. But if one

original: tesu dvīsupi vatthūsu majjhatto udāsino, ayaṃ sattasaṅkhāramajjhatto nāma. Iti ayaṃ
analyzed: tesu dvīsu pi vatthūsu majjhattaḥ udāsinaḥ ayam satta saṅkhāra majjhattaḥ nāma iti ayam
translated: He is neutral, indifferent, towards both of these kinds of persons. This is called the neutral person among the six kinds of persons.

original: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo evarūpaṃ sattasaṅkhārakelāyanapuggalaṃ ārakā parivajjentassāpi,
analyzed: upekkhā sambojjhaṅgaḥ evarūpam satta saṅkhāra kelāyana puggalam ārakā parivajjentassa api
translated: So this enlightenment factor of equanimity arises in one who avoids a person who indulges in talk about the six kinds of persons of this kind,

original: sattasaṅkhāramajjhattapuggalaṃ sevantassāpi, ṭhānanisajjādīsu taduppādanatthaṃ ninnapoṇapabbhāracittassāpi
analyzed: satta saṅkhāram ajjhatta puggalam sevantassa api ṭhāna nisajja ādīsu tad uppādana attham ninna poṇa pabbhāra cittassa api
translated: and in one who associates with a person who is neutral among the six kinds of persons, and in one who, in the various postures, has a mind that is inclined, tends, and leans to the arousing of equanimity.

original: uppajjati. Evaṃ uppannassa panassa arahattamaggena bhāvanāpāripūrī hoti.
analyzed: uppajjati evam uppannassa pana assa arahatta maggena bhāvanā pāripūrī hoti
translated: And when it has arisen in this way, its fulfilment comes about with the attainment of Arahantship by the path of arahantship.

original: Asubhanimittanti uddhumātakādibhedā dasa asubhārammaṇā dhammā. Yonisomanasikārabahulīkāroti
analyzed: asubha nimittam ti uddhumātaka ādi bhedāḥ dasa asubha ārammaṇāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: Sign of foulness: the ten kinds of foulness beginning with the bloated corpse are the object for this meditation subject. Frequent reflection:

original: ettha pana yonisomanasikāro nāma upāyamanasikāro, pathamanasikāro, uppādakamanasikāro.
analyzed: ettha pana yonisomanasikāro nāma upāya manasikāro patha manasikāro uppādaka manasikāro
translated: Herein, frequent reflection is reflection by a suitable means, initial reflection, productive reflection.

original: Apica cha dhammā kāmacchandassa pahānāya saṃvattanti – asubhanimittassa uggaho, asubhabhāvanānuyogo,
analyzed: apica cha dhammā kāmacchandassa pahānāya saṃvattanti asubha nimittassa uggahaḥ asubha bhāvanā anuyogo
translated: Besides, there are six things that lead to the abandoning of lust: learning the sign of foulness, pursuing the development of foulness meditation,

original: indriyesu guttadvāratā, bhojane mattaññutā, kalyāṇamittatā, sappāyakathāti.
analyzed: indriyesu gutta dvāra tā bhojane mattaññu tā kalyāṇa mitta tā sappāya kathā ati
translated: The guarding of the sense doors, moderation in eating, good friendship, and talk conducive to that.

original: Dasavidhañhi asubhanimittaṃ uggaṇhantassāpi kāmacchando pahīyati, bhāventassāpi,
analyzed: dasavidham hi asubha nimittam uggaṇhantassa api kāmacchandaḥ pahīyati bhāventassa api
translated: For lust is abandoned in one who learns the sign of foulness in ten aspects, in one who develops it,

original: indriyesu guttadvārassāpi, catunnaṃ pañcannaṃ ālopānaṃ okāse sati udakaṃ pivitvā
analyzed: indriyesu gutta dvārassa api catunnam pañcannam ālopānam okāse sati udakam pivitvā
translated: in one who guards the doors of the sense faculties, and in one who is moderate in eating, since he can maintain himself on the water offering made at the time of the four or five lumps.

original: yāpanasīlatāya bhojane mattaññunopi. Tenetaṃ vuttaṃ –
analyzed: yāpana sīla tāya bhojane mattaññunā api tena itam vuttam
translated: That is why it was said above:🔽“Having eaten four or five lumps,

original: “Cattāro pañca ālope, abhutvā udakaṃ pive;
analyzed: cattāraḥ pañca ālope a bhutvā udakam pive
translated: He should drink water and not more;🔽That is enough for the comfort

original: Alaṃ phāsuvihārāya, pahitattassa bhikkhuno”ti. ;
analyzed: alam phāsu vihārāya pahitattassa bhikkhuno ti
translated: Of a bhikkhu who is ardent” .

original: Asubhakammikatissattherasadise asubhabhāvanārate kalyāṇamitte sevantassāpi kāmacchando
analyzed: asubha kammika tissatthera sadise asubha bhāvanā rate kalyāṇa mitte sevantassa api kāmacchando
translated: And lust is abandoned in one who associates with good friends who are devoted to the development of foulness,

original: pahīyati, ṭhānanisajjādīsu dasaasubhanimittāya-sappāyakathāyapi pahīyati. Tena vuttaṃ
analyzed: pahīyati ṭhāna nisajja ādīsu pahīyati tena vuttam
translated: and in one who talks about the sign of foulness in the ten aspects. That is why it was said:🔽“Six things lead to the abandoning of lust” .

original: “cha dhammā kāmacchandassa pahānāya saṃvattantī”ti. Imehi pana chahi dhammehi pahīnassa
analyzed: cha dhammā kāmacchandassa pahānāya saṃvattanti iti imehi pana chahi dhammehi pahīnassa
translated: But when lust is abandoned in one by these six things,

original: kāmacchandassa arahattamaggena āyatiṃ anuppādo hoti.
analyzed: kāmacchandassa arahatta maggena āyatim anuppādaḥ hoti
translated: it does not arise again in the future, since it is abandoned by the path of arahatship.

original: Mettā cetovimuttīti ettha mettāti vutte appanāpi upacāropi vaṭṭati, cetovimuttīti
analyzed: mettā cetaḥ vimutti iti ettha mettā ati vutte appanā api upacāraḥ api vaṭṭati cetaḥ vimutti iti
translated: Herein, when it is said “deliverance of mind through loving-kindness,” the “loving-kindness” is both access and absorption;🔽but the “deliverance of mind” is absorption only.🔽The “wise attention” is that already described under the four noble truths.

original: appanāyeva. Yonisomanasikāro vuttalakkhaṇova. Apica cha dhammā byāpādassa pahānāya
analyzed: appanāya iva yoniso manasikāro vutta lakkhaṇaḥ va apica cha dhammā byāpādassa pahānāya
translated: And six things lead to the abandoning of ill will:🔽taking up the meditation subject,

original: saṃvattanti – mettānimittassa uggaho, mettābhāvanānuyogo, kammassakatāpaccavekkhaṇatā,
analyzed: saṃvattanti mettā nimittassa uggahaḥ mettā bhāvanā anuyogo kammassaka tā paccavekkhaṇa tā
translated: practising the meditation subject, reviewing the field of action,🔽having much sense of urgency,🔽having good friends,

original: paṭisaṅkhānabahulatā, kalyāṇamittatā, sappāyakathāti.🔽Odissakaanodissakadisāpharaṇānañhi aññataravasena mettaṃ uggaṇhantassāpi byāpādo
analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāna bahula tā kalyāṇa mitta tā sappāya kathā ati  odissaka anodissaka disāpharaṇānam hi aññatara vasena mettam uggaṇhantassa api byāpādaḥ
translated: and talk that inspires horror.🔽For when one is learning loving-kindness, ill will is abandoned in one who does so either by making the directions the starting point or by making living beings the starting point.

original: pahīyati, tathā odhisoanodhisodisāpharaṇavasena mettaṃ bhāventassāpi. “Tvaṃ etassa🔽kuddho kiṃ karissasi? Kimassa sīlādīni nāsetuṃ sakkhissasi? Nanu tvaṃ attano kammena
analyzed: pahīyati tathā bhāventassa api tvam etassa  kuddhaḥ kim karissasi kim assa sīla ādīni na āsetum sakkhissasi nanu tvam attanaḥ kammena
translated: And when one is developing loving-kindness, ill will is abandoned in one who does so either by making the directions the starting point or by making living beings the starting point.

original: āgantvā attano kammeneva gamissasi? Parassa kujjhanaṃ nāma vītaccikaṅgāratattaayasalākagūthādīni
analyzed: āgantvā attano kammena iva gamissasi parassa kujjhanam nāma
translated: “You are angry with him, but what will you do to him? Will you be able to destroy his virtue, etc., or his profitable things? You have come here as a result of your own kamma and you will depart as a result of your own kamma, and you will have to take rebirth as a result of your own kamma. What does he matter to you? ”🔽“He is angry with me, but what can he do to me? He cannot deprive me of life, etc., or deprive me of any of my profitable things. He cannot take me to a realm of suffering and make me suffer there. What does he matter to you? ”

original: gahetvā paraṃ paharitukāmatāsadisaṃ hoti. Esopi tava kuddho kiṃ karissati? Kiṃ te
analyzed: gahetvā param paharitu kāma tā sadisam hoti esaḥ api tava kuddhaḥ kim karissati kim te
translated: It is like one who seizes a weapon to strike another. What will this anger do to you when you are angry with him? Can it
