original: 8-10. Lokasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “World” sutta, etc.,

original: 394-396. Aṭṭhame mahābhiññatanti channaṃ abhiññānaṃ vasena vuttaṃ. Sahassaṃ lokaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭhame mahā abhiññatanti channam abhiññānam vasena vuttam sahassam lokam
translated: In the eighth, “great direct-knowledge”: this is said with reference to the six kinds of direct-knowledge.🔽“I know a thousand worlds” is said with reference to his abiding in the timeless.

original: abhijānāmīti satatavihāravaseneva vuttaṃ. Thero kira pātova uṭṭhāya mukhaṃ dhovitvā🔽senāsane nisinno atīte kappasahassaṃ, anāgate kappasahassaṃ anussarati, paccuppannepi🔽sahassaṃ cakkavāḷānaṃ tassāvajjanassa gatiṃ anubandhati. Iti so dibbena cakkhunā
analyzed: abhijānāmi iti satata vihāra vasena iva vuttam thero kira uṭṭhāya mukham dhovitvā  senāsane nisinnaḥ atīte kappa sahassam anāgate kappa sahassam anussarati paccuppanne pi  sahassam cakkavāḷānam gatim anubandhati iti so dibbena cakkhunā
translated: The elder, it seems, gets up at daybreak, washes his face,🔽and sitting down in his dwelling he recollects a thousand past world-cycles and a thousand future world-cycles. And in the present he follows the course of a thousand world-spheres.

original: sahassaṃ lokaṃ abhijānāti, ayamassa satatavihāro. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānatthamevāti.🔽Sīlaṭṭhitivaggo tatiyo.🔽4. Ananussutavaggavaṇṇanā🔽401-406. Catutthavaggassa pañcame viditā vedanāti yā vedanā sammasitvā arahattaṃ
analyzed: sahassam lokam abhijānāti ayam assa satata vihāraḥ sesam sabbattha uttāna attham eva ati 🔽sīlaṭṭhiti vaggo tatiyaḥ 🔽ananussuta vagga vaṇṇanā 🔽catuttha vaggassa pañcame viditā vedanā ati yā vedanā sammasitvā arahattam
translated: So with the divine eye he knows a thousand worlds. This is his timeless abiding. The rest is all clear.

original: patto tāvassa viditā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti🔽nāma. Yā ca pana pariggahitesu vatthārammaṇesu pavattā vedanā, tāpi viditā uppajjanti,
analyzed: patto tāva assa viditāḥ uppajjanti viditāḥ upaṭṭhahanti viditāḥ abbhattham gacchanti  nāma yā ca pana pariggahitesu vattha ārammaṇesu pavattā vedanā tā api viditā uppajjanti
translated: and the consciousness that arises in regard to them is known as it arises, known as it is present, known as it departs.🔽And the feeling that occurs in regard to the objects of clinging is also known as it arises, known as it is present, known as it departs.

original: viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti nāma. Vitakkādīsupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: viditāḥ upaṭṭhahanti viditāḥ abbhattham gacchanti nāma vitakka ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ
translated: The same method applies to the thoughts, etc.

original: Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānamevāti.
analyzed: sesam sabbattha uttānam eva ati
translated: The rest is clear throughout.

original: Ananussutavaggo catuttho.🔽5. Amatavaggo
analyzed: an anussuta vaggaḥ catutthaḥ  a mata vaggaḥ
translated: The fourth chapter is concluded.🔽THE CHAPTER ABOUT THE DEathless

original: 2. Samudayasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: samudaya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Suttas about Origination

original: 408. Pañcamavaggassa dutiye āhārasamudayā kāyassa samudayoti āhārasamudayena kāyasamudayo.
analyzed: pañcama vaggassa dutiye āhāra samudayā kāyassa samudayo ti āhāra samudayena kāya samudayo
translated: In the second sutta of the fifth chapter, the origin of the body is by the origin of nutriment.

original: Eseva nayo sesesu. Manasikārasamudayāti ettha pana yonisomanasikārasamudayā bojjhaṅgadhammānaṃ
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ sesesu manasikāra samudayā ti ettha pana yoniso manasikāra samudayāḥ bojjhaṅga dhammānam
translated: The same method applies to the rest. As to the origin of attention, the origin of the enlightenment factors is by the origin of right reflection,

original: samudayo, ayonisomanasikārasamudayā nīvaraṇadhammānaṃ. Iti imasmiṃ sutte sārammaṇasatipaṭṭhānā kathitā.🔽4. Satisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: samudayaḥ a yoniso manasikāra samudayā nīvaraṇa dhammānam iti imasmim sutte sa ārammaṇa sati paṭṭhānā kathitā 🔽sati sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: and the origin of the hindrances is by the origin of wrong reflection. So in this sutta mindfulness with an object is taught.

original: 410. Catutthaṃ suddhikaṃ katvā samudaye kathite bujjhanakānaṃ ajjhāsayena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: catuttham suddhikam katvā samudaye kathite bujjhanakānam ajjhāsayena vuttam
translated: The fourth is stated in the sense of the inclination of those who are awakened to the truth of origination, having made it pure.

original: 6. Pātimokkhasaṃvarasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pātimokkhasaṃvara sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discourse on Restraint by the Pāṭimokkha

original: 412. Chaṭṭhe pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvutoti catunnaṃ sīlānaṃ jeṭṭhakasīlaṃ dassento evamāha.
analyzed: chaṭṭhe pātimokkha saṃvara saṃvuto ti catunnam sīlānam jeṭṭhaka sīlam dassentaḥ evam āha
translated: In the sixth, “restrained by the Pāṭimokkha restraint” , he said this showing the seniormost virtue of the four virtues.

original: Tipiṭakacūḷanāgatthero panāha – “pātimokkhasaṃvarova sīlaṃ, itarāni tīṇi sīlanti
analyzed: tipiṭakacūḷanāga theraḥ pana āha sīlam itarāni tīṇi
translated: But the Elder Tipiṭaka Cūḷanāga said: “Restraint by the Pāṭimokkha is virtue. The other three are called ‘virtues’ .🔽There is no place where it is said that they are virtues.”

original: vuttaṭṭhānaṃ nāma natthī”ti. Vatvā taṃ anujānanto āha – “indriyasaṃvaro nāma chadvārarakkhaṇamattameva,
analyzed: vutta ṭṭhānam nāma natthi iti vatvā tam anujānantaḥ āha indriya saṃvaro nāma cha dvāra rakkhaṇam attam eva
translated: Having said that, he allowed it, saying: “Restraint of the faculties is merely the guarding of the six sense doors.🔽Purity of livelihood is merely the acquisition of requisites by fair means.

original: ājīvapārisuddhi dhammeneva samena paccayuppattimattakaṃ, paccayasannissitaṃ paṭiladdhapaccaye🔽idamatthanti paccavekkhitvā paribhuñjanamattakaṃ. Nippariyāyena pātimokkhasaṃvarova
analyzed: ājīva pārisuddhi dhammena iva samena paccayuppattimattakam paccaya sannissitam paṭiladdha paccaye  idam atthan ti paccavekkhitvā paribhuñjana mattakam nippariyāyena pātimokkha saṃvaraḥ uva
translated: Relying on requisites is merely the use of requisites that have been obtained after reviewing their purpose.🔽Restraint by the Pāṭimokkha is virtue in the strict sense.

original: sīlaṃ. Yassa so bhinno, ayaṃ chinnasīso viya puriso hatthapāde, sesāni rakkhissatīti
analyzed: sīlam yassa saḥ bhinnaḥ ayam chinna sīsaḥ viya puriso hattha pāde sesāni rakkhissati iti
translated: If it is broken, then just as a man with a severed hand or foot cannot save the rest of his body, so too, if this is broken, the other three cannot save it.

original: na vattabbo. Yassa pana so arogo, ayaṃ acchinnasīso viya puriso jīvitaṃ, sesāni puna🔽pākatikāni katvā rakkhitumpi sakkotī”ti. Tasmā pātimokkhasaṃvarova sīlaṃ, tena pātimokkhasaṃvarena
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ yassa pana saḥ arogaḥ ayam acchinna sīsaḥ viya purisaḥ jīvitam sesāni puna  pākatikāni katvā rakkhitum pi sakkoti iti tasmā pātimokkha saṃvaraḥ uva sīlam tena pātimokkha saṃvarena
translated: But it should not be said that he is not a bhikkhu. But he who is cured is like the man with the severed head: he is alive, but the rest of his faculties🔽can be preserved only by the exercise of care. So virtue is the restraint of the Patimokkha.

original: saṃvutoti pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto, upeto samannāgatoti attho.🔽Ācāragocarasampannoti ācārena ca gocarena ca sampanno. Aṇumattesūti appamattakesu.
analyzed: saṃvuto ti pātimokkha saṃvara saṃvuto upeto samannāgato ti attho  ācāra gocara sampannaḥ iti ācārena ca gocarena ca sampannaḥ aṇu mattesu iti appamattakesu
translated: He is restrained by the restraint of the Patimokkha: he is restrained by the Patimokkha restraint, he is endowed with it, is the meaning.🔽Endowed with conduct and resort: endowed with conduct and resort. In the slightest: in the most minute.

original: Vajjesūti akusaladhammesu. Bhayadassāvīti bhayadassī. Samādāyāti sammā ādiyitvā.🔽Sikkhassu sikkhāpadesūti sikkhāpadesu taṃ taṃ sikkhāpadaṃ samādiyitvā sikkha, yaṃ
analyzed: vajjesu ati akusala dhammesu bhaya dassāvī iti bhaya dassī samādāya ati sammā ādiyitvā  sikkhassu sikkhāpadesu iti sikkhāpadesu tam tam sikkhāpadam samādiyitvā sikkha yam
translated: In offences: in the unprofitable states called “offences.” Seeing fear: seeing danger. Having undertaken: having properly undertaken.

original: yaṃ pana kiñci sikkhāpadesu sikkhākoṭṭhāsesu sikkhitabbaṃ kāyikaṃ vā vācasikaṃ vā,
analyzed: yam pana kiñci sikkhāpadesu sikkhākoṭṭhāsesu sikkhitabbam kāyikam vā vācasikam vā
translated: Train in the training precepts: having undertaken this or that training precept, train in it. But whatever is to be trained in, in the training precepts, in the various parts of the training, in the training as a whole, whether bodily or verbally,

original: taṃ taṃ sabbaṃ sammā ādāya sikkhassūti ayamettha saṅkhepattho. Vitthāro pana visuddhimagge
analyzed: tam tam sabbam sammā ādāya sikkhassu iti ayam ettha saṅkhepa atthaḥ vitthāraḥ pana visuddhi magge
translated: all that should be properly undertaken and trained in. This is the condensed meaning here. The detailed meaning is given in the Path of Purity .

original: vutto. Iti imasmiṃ sutte pātimokkhasaṃvarasīlameva kathitaṃ.🔽7. Duccaritasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vuttaḥ iti imasmim sutte pātimokkha saṃvara sīlam eva kathitam  duccarita sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: is stated. So in this Thread virtue consisting in the rules of training is taught.🔽The commentary on the Difficult Conduct Thread is ended.

original: 413. Sattame kāyasucaritavacīsucaritāni pātimokkhasaṃvarasīlaṃ, manosucaritaṃ itarāni🔽tīṇi sīlānīti catupārisuddhisīlaṃ kathitaṃ hoti. Iminā nayena pañcasattanavadasasu
analyzed: sattame kāya su carita vacī su caritāni pātimokkha saṃvara sīlam manaḥ su caritam itarāni  tīṇi sīlāni iti catu pārisuddhi sīlam kathitam iminā nayena pañca satta navadasasu
translated: In the seventh, virtue consisting in good bodily conduct and good verbal conduct is virtue consisting in the rules of training, and good mental conduct is the other three kinds of virtue,

original: kusalakammapathesu pacchimāpi tayo sīlaṃ hotīti veditabbā. Sesaṃ uttānamevāti. Chaṭṭhasattamesu
analyzed: kusala kamma pathesu pacchimā api tayo sīlam hoti iti veditabbā sesam uttānam eva ati chaṭṭha sattamesu
translated: so that virtue consisting in the four kinds of purification is taught. In this way the last three of the fifty-five profitable courses of action should be understood as virtue. The rest is plain.

original: heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva attho veditabbo.
analyzed: heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva atthaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: In the sixth and seventh the meaning should be understood in the way already stated.

original: Amatavaggo pañcamo.
analyzed: amata vaggo pañcamaḥ
translated: The fifth vagga, the “Immortal” vagga, is ended.

original: Satipaṭṭhānasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽4. Indriyasaṃyuttaṃ🔽1. Suddhikavaggo
analyzed: sati paṭṭhāna saṃyutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  indriya saṃyuttam  suddhika vaggo
translated: The exposition of the “Conjunction with Mindfulness” is ended.🔽The “Conjunction with Faculties”🔽The “Purity” Vagga

original: 1. Suddhikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: suddhika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The “Purity” Thread

original: 471. Indriyasaṃyuttassa paṭhame saddhindriyaṃ satindriyaṃ paññindriyanti imāni tīṇi
analyzed: indriya saṃyuttassa paṭhame saddhindriyam satindriyam paññindriyanti imāni tīṇi
translated: In the first of the “Conjunction with Faculties” the three beginning with the faith faculty, the mindfulness faculty, and the understanding faculty

original: catubhūmakakusalavipākesu ceva kiriyāsu ca labbhanti. Vīriyindriyasamādhindriyāni
analyzed: catu bhūmaka kusala vipākesu ca iva kiriyāsu ca labbhanti vīriyindriya samādhindriyāni
translated: are found in the profitable and resultant consciousnesses of the four planes and in the functional consciousnesses. The energy faculty and the concentration faculty

original: catubhūmakakusale akusale vipāke kiriyāyāti sabbattha labbhanti. Iti idaṃ suttaṃ
analyzed: catu bhūmaka kusale akusale vipāke kiriyāya ati sabbattha labbhanti iti idam suttam
translated: and in the profitable, unprofitable, resultant, and in- formation of the four planes, everywhere. So this Thread

original: catubhūmakasabbasaṅgāhakadhammaparicchedavasena vuttanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: catu bhūmaka sabba saṅgāhaka dhamma pariccheda vasena vuttan ti veditabbam
translated: and in the profitable, unprofitable, resultant, and in- formation of the four planes, and they are found everywhere. So this Thread should be understood as said in order to include all states in the four planes.

original: 7. Dutiyasamaṇabrāhmaṇasuttavaṇṇanā🔽477. Sattame saddhindriyaṃ nappajānantīti dukkhasaccavasena na pajānanti. Saddhindriyasamudayaṃ🔽nappajānantīti samudayasaccavasena na pajānanti. Evaṃ nirodhaṃ nirodhasaccavasena,
analyzed: dutiya samaṇa brāhmaṇa sutta vaṇṇanā  sattame saddhi indriyam na ppajānanti iti dukkha sacca vasena na pajānanti saddhi indriya samudayam  na pajānanti iti samudaya sacca vasena na pajānanti evam nirodham nirodha sacca vasena
translated: . Commentary on the Second Thread on Brahmins and Ascetics

original: paṭipadaṃ maggasaccavasenāti. Sesesupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: paṭipadam magga sacca vasena ati sesesu pi esa iva nayaḥ
translated: “They do not understand the faith faculty” : they do not understand it in the case of the truth of suffering. “ They do not understand the faith faculty’s origin” : they do not understand it in the case of the truth of the origin of suffering. So too with the cessation of suffering and the way leading to the cessation of suffering. The same method applies in the case of the rest.

original: Sukkapakkhe pana adhimokkhavasena āvajjanasamudayā saddhindriyasamudayo hoti, paggahavasena🔽āvajjanasamudayā vīriyindriyasamudayo, upaṭṭhānavasena āvajjanasamudayā satindriyasamudayo,
analyzed: sukka pakkhe pana adhimokkha vasena āvajjana samudayā saddhi indriya samudayaḥ hoti paggaha vasena  āvajjana samudayā vīriya indriya samudayo upaṭṭhāna vasena āvajjana samudayā sati indriya samudayo
translated: But in the bright side, the faith faculty’s origin is the origin of the faith faculty in the sense of resolution,🔽the energy faculty’s origin is the origin of the energy faculty in the sense of exertion,🔽the mindfulness faculty’s origin is the origin of the mindfulness faculty in the sense of establishment,

original: avikkhepavasena āvajjanasamudayā samādhindriyasamudayo, dassanavasena āvajjanasamudayā
analyzed: avikkhepa vasena āvajjana samudayā samādhi indriya samudayaḥ dassana vasena āvajjana samudayā
translated: the concentration faculty’s origin is the origin of the concentration faculty in the sense of non-distraction,🔽the understanding faculty’s origin is the origin of the understanding faculty in the sense of seeing.

original: paññindriyasamudayo hoti. Tathā chandavasena āvajjanasamudayā saddhindriyasamudayo🔽hoti, chandavasena āvajjanasamudayā vīriyasatisamādhipaññindriyasamudayo hoti. Manasikāravasena
analyzed: paññindriya samudayaḥ tathā chanda vasena āvajjana samudayā saddhindriya samudayaḥ  hoti chanda vasena āvajjana samudayā vīriya sati samādhi paññindriya samudayaḥ hoti manasikāra vasena
translated: The origin of the faith faculty is the origin of the energy faculty, etc.🔽The origin of the faith faculty is the origin of the mindfulness faculty, the concentration faculty, and the understanding faculty.🔽The origin of the energy faculty is the origin of the mindfulness faculty, the concentration faculty, and the understanding faculty.

original: āvajjanasamudayā saddhindriyasamudayo hoti. Manasikāravasena āvajjanasamudayā vīriyasatisamādhipaññindriyasamudayo
analyzed: āvajjana samudayā saddhi indriya samudayaḥ manasikāra vasena āvajjana samudayā vīriya sati samādhi paññindriya samudayaḥ
translated: The origin of the mindfulness faculty is the origin of the concentration faculty and the understanding faculty.🔽The origin of the concentration faculty is the origin of the understanding faculty.🔽The origin of the understanding faculty is the origin of the understanding faculty.

original: hotīti evampi attho veditabbo. Imesu paṭipāṭiyā chasu suttesu catusaccameva kathitaṃ.
analyzed: hoti iti evam pi atthaḥ veditabbaḥ imesu paṭipāṭiyā chasu suttesu catu saccam eva kathitam
translated: The meaning should be understood in this way. In these six sutta passages in succession the four truths are stated.

original: 8. Daṭṭhabbasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: daṭṭhabba sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The explanation of the “Discourse on What Should be Seen” .

original: 478. Aṭṭhame kattha ca, bhikkhave, saddhindriyaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, catūsu sotāpattiyaṅgesūtiādi
analyzed: aṭṭhame kattha ca bhikkhave saddhi indriyam daṭṭhabbam catūsu sotāpattiyaṅgesu itiādi
translated: In the eighth sutta, “And in what way, bhikkhus, should the faith faculty be seen? In the four factors of stream-entry” ,🔽this is said in order to show that these faculties are the most important in their respective domains. For just as four sons of wealthy men

original: imesaṃ indriyānaṃ savisaye jeṭṭhakabhāvadassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Yathā hi cattāro seṭṭhiputtā
analyzed: imesam indriyānam sa visaye jeṭṭhaka bhāva dassana attham vuttam yathā hi cattāro seṭṭhi puttāḥ
translated: who were friends,

original: rājāti rājapañcamesu sahāyesu “nakkhattaṃ kīḷissāmā”ti vīthiṃ otiṇṇesu ekassa seṭṭhiputtassa
analyzed: rājā ati rāja pañcamesu sahāyesu nakkhattam kīḷissāma ati vīthim otiṇṇesu ekassa seṭṭhi puttassa
translated: having gone out into the street to play,

original: gehaṃ gatakāle itare cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti, gehasāmikova – “imesaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ🔽detha, gandhamālālaṅkārādīni dethā”ti gehe vicāreti. Dutiyassa, tatiyassa, catutthassa🔽gehaṃ gatakāle itare cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti, gehasāmikova – “imesaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ
analyzed: geham gata kāle itare cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti geha sāmikā uva imesam khādanīyam bhojanīyam  gandha mālā alaṅkāra ādīni detha ati gehe vicāra iti dutiyassa tatiyassa catutthassa  geham gata kāle itare cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti geha sāmikā uva imesam khādanīyam bhojanīyam
translated: When the first had gone to the house, the other four sat silent, and the householder went about the house giving orders: “Give them fresh food and cooked food, give them perfumes, garlands, and ornaments.”🔽When the second had gone to the house, the other three sat silent, and the householder went about the house giving orders: “Give them fresh food and cooked food, give them perfumes, garlands, and ornaments.”

original: detha, gandhamālālaṅkārādīni dethā”ti gehe vicāreti. Atha sabbapacchā rañño gehaṃ🔽gatakāle kiñcāpi rājā sabbattha issaro, imasmiṃ pana kāle attano geheyeva – “imesaṃ
analyzed: detha gandha mālā alaṅkāra ādīni detha ati gehe vicāreti atha sabba pacchā raññaḥ gehaṃ  gata kāle kiñca api rājā sabbattha issaraḥ imasmin pana kāle attanaḥ geheya iva imesam
translated: When the third had gone to the house, the other two sat silent, and the householder went about the house giving orders: “Give them fresh food and cooked food, give them perfumes, garlands, and ornaments.”

original: khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ detha, gandhamālālaṅkārādīni dethā”ti gehe vicāreti. Evameva
analyzed: khādanīyam bhojanīyam detha gandha mālā alaṅkāra ādīni detha ati gehe vicāra iti evam eva
translated: Then when the king had gone to the house last of all, although he was master of all, he went about the house giving orders only in his own house: “Give them fresh food and cooked food, give them perfumes, garlands, and ornaments.”

original: saddhāpañcamakesu indriyesu tesu sahāyesu ekato vīthiṃ otarantesu viya ekārammaṇe🔽uppajjamānesupi yathā paṭhamassa gehe itare cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti, gehasāmikova
analyzed: saddhā pañcamakesu indriyesu tesu sahāyesu ekatas vīthim otarantesu viya eka ārammaṇe 🔽uppajjamānesu pi yathā paṭhamassa gehe itare cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti geha sāmikā uva
translated: So too, when the five faculties beginning with faith arise with a single object, although the master faculty is master of all, it is only the master in its own object.

original: vicāreti, evaṃ sotāpattiyaṅgāni patvā adhimokkhalakkhaṇaṃ saddhindriyameva jeṭṭhakaṃ
analyzed: vicāra iti evam sa utāpattiyaṅgāni patvā adhimokkha lakkhaṇam saddhindriyam eva jeṭṭhakam
translated: When it has done so, then the faith faculty, which has the characteristic of resolution, is the chief among the factors of stream-entry.

original: hoti pubbaṅgamaṃ, sesāni tadanvayāni honti. Yathā dutiyassa gehe itare cattāro tuṇhī
analyzed: hoti pubbaṅgamam sesāni tad anvayāni honti yathā dutiyassa gehe itare cattāro tuṇhī
translated: The rest are its concomitants. Just as in the second house the other four sit silently while the householder sits and thinks,

original: nisīdanti, gehasāmikova vicāreti, evaṃ sammappadhānāni patvā paggahalakkhaṇaṃ vīriyindriyameva
analyzed: nisīdanti geha sāmikaḥ uva vicāreti evam sammappadhānāni patvā paggaha lakkhaṇam vīriya indriyam eva
translated: so too, when the right endeavours have been reached, the energy faculty, which has the characteristic of exerting, is the chief.

original: jeṭṭhakaṃ hoti pubbaṅgamaṃ, sesāni tadanvayāni honti. Yathā tatiyassa gehe itare🔽cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti, gehasāmikova vicāreti, evaṃ satipaṭṭhānāni patvā upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇaṃ🔽satindriyameva jeṭṭhakaṃ hoti pubbaṅgamaṃ, sesāni tadanvayāni honti. Yathā catutthassa
analyzed: jeṭṭhakam hoti pubbaṅgamam sesāni tad anvayāni honti yathā tatiyassa gehe itare  cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti geha sāmikā uva vicāreti evam sati paṭṭhānāni patvā upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇam  sati indriyam eva jeṭṭhakam hoti pubbaṅgamam sesāni tad anvayāni honti yathā catutthassa
translated: The rest are its concomitants. Just as in the third house the other four sit silently while the householder sits and thinks,🔽so too, when the foundations of mindfulness have been reached, the mindfulness faculty, which has the characteristic of establishing, is the chief.

original: gehe itare cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti, gehasāmikova vicāreti, evaṃ jhānavimokkhe patvā
analyzed: gehe itare cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti geha sāmikā uva vicāreti evam jhāna vimokkhe patvā
translated: The rest are its concomitants. Just as in the fourth house the other four sit silently while the householder sits and thinks,

original: avikkhepalakkhaṇaṃ samādhindriyameva jeṭṭhakaṃ hoti pubbaṅgamaṃ, sesāni tadanvayāni
analyzed: avikkhepa lakkhaṇam samādhi indriyam eva jeṭṭhakam hoti pubbaṅgamam sesāni tad anvayāni
translated: so too, when the jhāna liberations have been reached, the concentration faculty, which has the characteristic of non-distraction, is the chief.🔽The rest are its concomitants.

original: honti. Sabbapacchā rañño gehaṃ gatakāle pana yathā itare cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti,
analyzed: honti sabbapacchā raññaḥ geham gata kāle pana yathā itare cattāro tuṇhī nisīdanti
translated: and the rest are as stated. But when all have gone to the King’s house, the other four sit silent,

original: rājāva gehe vicāreti, evameva ariyasaccāni patvā pajānanalakkhaṇaṃ paññindriyameva
analyzed: rājā ava gehe vicāreti evam eva ariya saccāni patvā pajānana lakkhaṇam paññindriyam eva
translated: and the King alone goes about the house. So too, when the four ariya-saccades have been reached and understood, the faculty of understanding, which has the characteristic of knowing,

original: jeṭṭhakaṃ hoti pubbaṅgamaṃ, sesāni tadanvayāni hontīti.
analyzed: jeṭṭhakam hoti pubbaṅgamam sesāni tad anvayāni honti iti
translated: is the eldest and the leader, and the rest are in accordance with it.

original: 9-10. Paṭhamavibhaṅgasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The first section for recitation on the faculties is finished.

original: 479-480. Navame satinepakkenāti ettha nipakassa bhāvo nepakkaṃ, paññāyetaṃ nāmaṃ.
analyzed: navame sati nepakkena ati ettha nipakassa bhāvaḥ nepakkam paññāyetam nāmam
translated: In the ninth case, “through carefulness”: the state of being careful is carefulness. This is a name for understanding.

original: Kasmā pana satibhājane paññā vuttāti? Satiyā balavabhāvadassanatthaṃ. Balavasati🔽hi idha adhippetā. Sā ca paññāsampayuttāva balavatī hoti, na vippayuttāti paññāsampayuttasatiṃ
analyzed: kasmā pana sati bhājane paññā vuttā iti satiyāḥ balava bhāva dassana attham balava sati  hi idha adhippetā sā ca paññā sampayuttā ava balavatī hoti na vippayuttā ati paññā sampayutta satim
translated: But why is understanding stated in the section on mindfulness? In order to show the strength of mindfulness. For strong mindfulness

original: dassento evamāha. Cirakatanti cirakālaṃ kataṃ dānaṃ vā sīlaṃ vā uposathakammaṃ vā.
analyzed: dassentaḥ evam āha cirakatam ti cira kālam katam dānam vā sīlam vā uposatha kammam vā
translated: is intended here. And that is strong only when associated with understanding, not when unassociated with understanding. So he said this in order to show mindfulness associated with understanding. “Long since done”: given or observed or undertaken long ago.

original: Cirabhāsitanti “asukasmiṃ ṭhāne asukaṃ nāma bhāsita”nti evaṃ cirakāle bhāsitaṃ. Vossaggārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: cira bhāsitanti asukasmin ṭhāne asukam nāma bhāsitanti evam cira kāle bhāsitam vossagga ārammaṇam
translated: “Long since spoken”: spoken long ago thus, “Such and such was spoken in such and such a place.” “With relinquishment as object”

original: katvāti nibbānārammaṇaṃ katvā. Udayatthagāminiyāti udayañca atthañca gacchantiyā,
analyzed: katvā ti nibbāna ārammaṇam katvā udaya ttha gāminiyā ti udayañca atthañca gacchantiyā
translated: ‘Having made’: having made it the object of Nibbāna. ‘Leading to rise and fall’: going to rise and fall,

original: udayabbayapariggahikāyāti attho. Imasmiṃ sutte saddhāsatipaññindriyāni pubbabhāgāni,
analyzed: udaya bbaya pariggahikāya ti atthaḥ imasmin sutte saddhā sati paññā indriyāni pubba bhāgāni
translated: the meaning is, that discern rise and fall. In this sutta the faculties of faith, mindfulness, and understanding are the prior side,

original: vīriyindriyaṃ missakaṃ, samādhindriyaṃ nibbattitalokuttarameva kathitaṃ. Dasamepi
analyzed: vīriya indriyam missakam samādhi indriyam nibbattita lokuttaram eva kathitam dasame pi
translated: the faculty of energy is mixed, and the faculty of concentration is only the supramundane that is produced. In the tenth too

original: ayameva dhammaparicchedoti.
analyzed: ayam eva dhamma paricchedaḥ ti
translated: this is the same as the chapter on ideas.

original: Suddhikavaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: suddhika vaggo paṭhamaḥ
translated: The first section is finished.

original: 2. Mudutaravaggo
analyzed: mudutara vaggo
translated: THE SECTION WITH MUDUTARA

original: 1. Paṭilābhasuttavaṇṇanā🔽481. Dutiyavaggassa paṭhame sammappadhāne ārabbhāti sammappadhāne paṭicca, sammappadhāne bhāventoti attho. Satindriyepi eseva nayo.🔽2. Paṭhamasaṃkhittasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭilābha sutta vaṇṇanā  dutiya vaggassa paṭhame sammappadhāne ārabbha ati sammappadhāne paṭicca sammappadhāne bhāvento ti attho sati indriye pi esa eva nayo
translated: 1. The Sutta on Acquisition

original: 482. Dutiye tatoti vipassanāmaggaphalavasena nissakkaṃ veditabbaṃ. Samattāni hi paripuṇṇāni🔽pañcindriyāni arahattamaggassa vipassanindriyāni nāma honti. Tato mudutarehīti tehi
analyzed: dutiye tatas ti vipassanā magga phala vasena nissakkam veditabbam samattāni hi paripuṇṇāni 🔽pañca indriyāni arahatta maggassa vipassanindriyāni nāma honti tatas mudutarehi iti tehi
translated: In the first of the second section, ‘with right endeavour as the footing’ means with right endeavour as the footing, with right endeavour as the cause, with right endeavour as the reason, with right endeavour as the condition, with right endeavour as the foundation, with right endeavour as the support, with right endeavour as the basis, with right endeavour as the instigation, with right endeavour as the instigation-cause, with right endeavour as the instigation-reason, with right endeavour as the instigation-condition, with right endeavour as the instigation-foundation, with right endeavour as the instigation-support, with right endeavour as the instigation-basis, with right endeavour as the instigation-cause, with right endeavour as the instigation-reason, with right endeavour as the instigation-condition, with right endeavour as the instigation-foundation, with right endeavour as the instigation-support, with right endeavour as the instigation-basis, with right endeavour as the instigation-cause, with right endeavour as the instigation-reason, with right endeavour as the instigation-condition, with right endeavour as the instigation-foundation, with right endeavour as the instigation-support, with right endeavour as the instigation-basis, with right endeavour as the instigation-cause, with right endeavour as the instigation-reason, with right endeavour as the instigation-condition, with right endeavour as the instigation-foundation, with right endeavour as the instigation-support, with right endeavour as the instigation-basis, with right endeavour as the instigation-cause, with right endeavour as the instigation-reason, with right endeavour as the instigation-condition, with right endeavour as the instigation-foundation, with right endeavour as the instigation-support, with right endeavour as the instigation-basis, with right endeavour as the instigation-cause, with right endeavour as the instigation-reason,

original: arahattamaggassa vipassanindriyehi mudutarāni anāgāmimaggassa vipassanindriyāni nāma
analyzed: arahatta maggassa vipassanī indriyehi mudutarāni anāgāmi maggassa vipassanī indriyāni nāma
translated: The insight faculties of the path of arahantship are more blunt than the insight faculties of the path of non-returning,

original: honti, tato mudutarāni sakadāgāmimaggassa, tato mudutarāni sotāpattimaggassa vipassanindriyāni🔽nāma honti, tato mudutarāni dhammānusārimaggassa, tato mudutarāni saddhānusārimaggassa
analyzed: honti tatas mudutarāni sakadāgāmi maggassa tatas mudutarāni sotāpatti maggassa vipassan indriyāni  nāma honti tatas mudutarāni dhamma anusāri maggassa tatas mudutarāni saddhā anusāri maggassa
translated: the insight faculties of the path of non-returning are more blunt than the insight faculties of the path of once-returning, the insight faculties of the path of once-returning are more blunt than the insight faculties of the path of stream-entry,

original: vipassanindriyāni nāma honti.
analyzed: vipassanindriyāni nāma honti
translated: the insight faculties of the path of stream-entry are more blunt than the faculties of the path of the Dhamma-follower, the insight faculties of the path of the Dhamma-follower are more blunt than the faculties of the path of the faith-follower.

original: Tathā samattāni paripuṇṇāni pañcindriyāni arahattamaggindriyāni nāma honti, tato
analyzed: tathā sa mattāni paripuṇṇāni pañca indriyāni arahattamaggindriyāni nāma honti tato
translated: The five faculties that are complete and fulfilled are called the faculties of the path of arahantship,

original: mudutarāni anāgāmimaggindriyāni nāma honti, tato mudutarāni sakadāgāmimaggindriyāni
analyzed: mudutarāni anāgāmi magga indriyāni nāma honti tatas mudutarāni sakadāgāmi magga indriyāni
translated: the faculties of the path of non-returning are called more blunt than those, the faculties of the path of once-returning are called more blunt than those,

original: nāma honti, tato mudutarāni sotāpattimaggindriyāni nāma honti, tato mudutarāni dhammānusārimaggindriyāni,
analyzed: nāma honti tatas mudutarāni sa utāpatti magga indriyāni nāma honti tatas mudutarāni dhamma anusāri magga indriyāni
translated: the faculties of the path of stream-entry are called more blunt than those, the faculties of the path of the Dhamma-follower are called more blunt than those,

original: tato mudutarāni saddhānusārimaggindriyāni nāma honti.
analyzed: tatas mudutarāni saddhā anusāri maggindriyāni nāma honti
translated: the faculties of the path of the faith-follower are called more blunt than those.

original: Samattāni paripuṇṇāni pañcindriyāni arahattaphalindriyāni nāma honti, tato mudutarāni
analyzed: sa mattāni paripuṇṇāni pañca indriyāni arahatta phalindriyāni nāma honti tatas mudutarāni
translated: The faculties in one who has reached Arahantship are called the faculties of Arahantship. They are more blunt than

original: anāgāmiphalindriyāni, tato mudutarāni sakadāgāmiphalindriyāni, tato mudutarāni sotāpattiphalindriyāni
analyzed: anāgāmi phal indriyāni tatas mudutarāni sakadāgāmi phal indriyāni tatas mudutarāni sa utāpatti phal indriyāni
translated: those in one who has reached the fruition of non-return. Those are more blunt than those in one who has reached the fruition of once-return. Those are more blunt than those in one who has reached the fruition of stream-entry.

original: nāma honti. Dhammānusārisaddhānusārino pana dvepi sotāpattimaggaṭṭhapuggalā, maggaṭṭhapuggalavasena🔽nesaṃ nānattaṃ jātanti āgamanenapi maggenapi. Saddhānusārī puggalo hi uddisāpento
analyzed: nāma honti dhamma anusāri saddhā anusārino pana dve pi sotāpatti magga ṭṭha puggalāḥ magga ṭṭha puggala vasena  na īsam nānattam jātanti āgamanena api maggena api saddhā anusārī puggalaḥ hi uddisāpentaḥ
translated: The two kinds of persons, the faith devotee and the one by Dhamma, are both in the state of the path of stream-entry. The difference between them is due to the state of the path and to the arrival.

original: paripucchanto anupubbena maggaṃ pāpuṇāti, dhammānusārī ekena vā dvīhi vā savanehi.
analyzed: paripucchantaḥ anupubbena maggam pāpuṇāti dhamma anusārī ekena vā dvīhi vā savanehi
translated: For the faith devotee, when he is being instructed and questioned, reaches the path gradually, while the one by Dhamma does so in one or two sittings.

original: Evaṃ tāva nesaṃ āgamanena nānattaṃ veditabbaṃ.🔽Dhammānusārissa pana maggo tikkho hoti, sūraṃ ñāṇaṃ vahati, asaṅkhārena appayogena
analyzed: evam tāva na isam āgamanena nānattam veditabbam  dhamma anusārissa pana maggaḥ tikkhaḥ hoti sūram ñāṇam vahati asaṅkhārena appayogena
translated: This is how their difference due to arrival should be understood.🔽But the one by Dhamma’s path is sharp, his knowledge is strong, he cuts off defilements without difficulty, without exertion,

original: kilese chindati kadalikkhandhaṃ viya tikhiṇā asidhārā. Saddhānusārissa na tassa viya
analyzed: kilese chindati kadali kkhandham viya tikhiṇā asi dhārā saddhā anusārissa na tassa viya
translated: like a sharp sword cuts through a plantain trunk. The faith devotee’s is not like that.

original: maggo tikkho hoti, na sūraṃ ñāṇaṃ vahati, sasaṅkhārena sappayogena kilese chindati
analyzed: maggaḥ tikkhaḥ hoti na sūram ñāṇam vahati sa saṅkhārena sa payogena kilese chindati
translated: The path is sharp, knowledge does not flow smoothly, he cuts defilements with applied thought and sustained thought.

original: kadalikkhandhaṃ viya atikhiṇā asidhārā. Kilesakkhaye pana tesaṃ nānattaṃ natthi.
analyzed: kadali kkhandham viya ati khiṇā asi dhārā kilesa khaye pana tesam nānattam natthi
translated: The edge of the sword is very sharp, like the blade of a sword. But there is no difference between them in the destruction of defilements.

original: Avasesā ca kilesā khīyanti.
analyzed: ca kilesā
translated: And the rest of the defilements are destroyed.

original: 3. Dutiyasaṃkhittasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya saṃkhitta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The second brief explanation of the faculties

original: 483. Tatiye tatoti phalavasena nissakkaṃ veditabbaṃ. Samattāni hi paripuṇṇāni pañcindriyāni🔽arahattaphalindriyāni nāma honti, arahattaphalena samannāgato puggalo arahā nāma
analyzed: tatiye tatas ti phala vasena nissakkam veditabbam samattāni hi paripuṇṇāni pañca indriyāni  arahatta phala indriyāni nāma honti arahatta phalena samannāgataḥ puggalaḥ arahā nāma
translated: In the third, “after that” should be understood as the fruit. For the five faculties, when complete and fulfilled,🔽are called the faculties of the fruit of arahantship. A person possessing the fruit of arahantship is called an arahant.

original: hoti. Arahattaphalato mudutarāni anāgāmiphalindriyāni nāma honti, tato mudutarāni🔽sakadāgāmiphalindriyāni, tato mudutarāni sotāpattiphalindriyāni, sotāpattiphalena
analyzed: hoti arahatta phalataḥ mudutarāni anāgāmi phala indriyāni nāma honti tatas mudutarāni  sakadāgāmi phala indriyāni tatas mudutarāni sotāpatti phala indriyāni sotāpatti phalena
translated: The faculties of the fruit of non-return are more refined than those of the fruit of arahantship;🔽the faculties of the fruit of once-return are more refined than those of the fruit of non-return; the faculties of the fruit of stream-entry are more refined than those of the fruit of once-return. A person possessing the fruit of stream-entry is called a stream-enterer.

original: samannāgato puggalo sotāpanno nāma hoti. Indriyavemattatā phalavemattatā hotīti indriyanānattena
analyzed: samannāgataḥ puggalo sotāpannaḥ nāma hoti indriya vematta tā phala vematta tā hoti iti indriya nānattena
translated: The difference in the faculties is the difference in the fruits.

original: phalanānattaṃ, phalanānattena puggalanānattanti.
analyzed: phala nānattam phala nānattena puggala nānattanti
translated: and the diversity of persons is due to the diversity of fruits.

original: 4. Tatiyasaṃkhittasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tatiya saṃkhitta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The third short exposition

original: 484. Catutthe paripūraṃ paripūrakārī ārādhetīti paripūraṃ arahattamaggaṃ karonto
analyzed: catutthe paripūram paripūra kārī ārādheti iti paripūram arahatta maggam karonto
translated: In the fourth, “one who fulfils fulfils the fulfilled” fulfils the fruit of Arahantship by making the Arahant path complete.

original: arahattaphalaṃ ārādheti. Padesaṃ padesakārīti avasese tayo padesamagge karonto padesaṃ
analyzed: arahatta phalam ārādha iti padesam padesa kārī iti avasese tayo padesa magge karonto padesam
translated: “One who does a portion does a portion” fulfils only the three fruits by making the remaining three paths a portion.

original: phalattayamattameva ārādheti. Iti imesu catūsupi suttesu missakāneva indriyāni kathitāni.
analyzed: phalattaya mattam eva ārādha iti iti imesu catūsu pi suttesu indriyāni kathitāni
translated: So in these four sutta-passages mixed faculties are spoken of.

original: 5-7. Paṭhamavitthārasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The first long exposition, etc.

original: 485-487. Pañcame tato mudutarehīti vipassanāvasena nissakkaṃ veditabbaṃ. Paripuṇṇāni🔽hi pañcindriyāni arahattamaggassa vipassanindriyāni honti, tato mudutarāni antarāparinibbāyissa
analyzed: pañcame tatas mudutarehi iti vipassanā vasena nissakkam veditabbam paripuṇṇāni  hi pañca indriyāni arahatta maggassa vipassani indriyāni honti tatas mudutarāni antarā aparinibbāyissa
translated: In the fifth, “then with still more tender ones” should be understood as “with still more tender insight.”

original: vipassanindriyāni, tato mudutarāni upahaccaparinibbāyissa, tato mudutarāni asaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa,
analyzed: vipassanī indriyāni tatas mudutarāni upahacca parinibbāyissa tatas mudutarāni asaṅkhāra parinibbāyissa
translated: For the five faculties that are fulfilled are the insight faculties of the Arahant path; then with still more tender ones are the insight faculties of the once-returner path; then with still more tender ones are the insight faculties of the non-returner path; then with still more tender ones are the insight faculties of the stream-enterer path;

original: tato mudutarāni sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa, tato mudutarāni uddhaṃsotaakaniṭṭhagāmissa🔽vipassanindriyāni nāma honti.🔽Imasmiṃ pana ṭhāne arahattamaggeyeva ṭhatvā pañca nissakkāni nīharitabbāni. Arahattamaggassa🔽hi vipassanindriyehi mudutarāni paṭhamaantarāparinibbāyissa vipassanindriyāni, tato🔽mudutarāni dutiyaantarāparinibbāyissa, tato mudutarāni tatiyaantarāparinibbāyissa,🔽tato mudutarāni upahaccaparinibbāyissa, tato mudutarāni uddhaṃsotaakaniṭṭhagāmissa🔽vipassanindriyāni. Asaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyinopi eteva pañca janā.
analyzed: tatas mudutarāni sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyissa tatas mudutarāni  vipassanindriyāni nāma honti  imasmim pana ṭhāne arahatta magge iya iva ṭhatvā pañca nissakkāni nīharitabbāni arahatta maggassa  hi vipassanī indriyehi mudutarāni vipassanī indriyāni tatas  mudutarāni dutiya antarā aparinibbāyissa tatas mudutarāni tatiya antarā aparinibbāyissa  tatas mudutarāni upahacca parinibbāyissa tatas mudutarāni  vipassanī indriyāni asaṅkhāra parinibbāyissa sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyinaḥ api ete iva pañca janāḥ
translated: still more refined are those of the non-returner who attains extinction upon landing , still more refined are those of the non-returner who goes upstream to the Pure Abodes,

original: Idāni tīṇi nissakkāni. Sakadāgāmimaggassa hi indriyehi mudutarāni sotāpattimaggindriyāni,
analyzed: idāni tīṇi nissakkāni sakadāgāmi maggassa hi indriyehi mudutarāni sotāpatti magga indriyāni
